title: Backend Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 King operates mobile games at a massive scale. With titles like Candy Crush, Bubble Witch and Farm Heroes our code runs on hundreds of millions of devices across the world.
   

  

 We are looking for a Java Backend Developer that will take pride in creating the very best bite sized entertainment for millions of players worldwide.
   

  

 Your role within our Kingdom
   

  

 The Monetisation & Rewards area is responsible for building complex, high-scale, real-time systems, working closely with other parts of the business to support the monetisation activities for our popular games. We are looking for a backend developer with practical experience in Java, and the drive and enthusiasm to succeed in a demanding and professional team environment. Our ideal candidate will be:
   

  

* A team player who likes to discuss solutions and ideas.
* Striving to be a genius in your area of expertise.
* Build valuable tools to support the game development process


 Skills to create thrills
   

  

 You have a great passion for programming and a solid sense of quality and polish. As a developer, you are also analytical and genuinely interested in understanding the whole tech stack. You must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and be a strong team player, able to work in a fast-paced, demanding yet fun professional environment.
   

  

* Experienced in Java, databases and web development in general.
* Used to UNIX environments.
* Strong knowledge of web protocols, application servers and web servers.
* Strong Computer Science fundamentals, design patterns and object-oriented knowledge
* Design, architect, test, document and implement features in our core services
* Deliver high-quality and well-structured code


* Used to TDD
* Familiar with HTML, CSS, Javascript, Bash


 A great saga needs all sorts of heroes
   

  

 Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it.
   

  

 We’re Seriously Playful
   

  

 Officially, we’re a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world. Unofficially, we’re a serious business that’s not afraid to have fun. Every day at King, we mix intuition with logic, art with science and magic with mathematics to create the games the world loves to play. Together with our parent company Activision Blizzard, our mission is to bring moments of magic to everyday life. If you think this is something you can help us achieve, let’s talk.
   

  

 At King, we bring moments of magic to hundreds of millions of players every day—and we’re just getting started. Join us on the journey.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Software & AI Developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose smoke-free enjoyment. How? By offering people other nicotine products online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with eleven store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 300 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to smoke-free alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 Join our Data Team as a Full Stack Applications/AI Developer, where you'll be at the forefront of transforming business processes through innovative Data & AI solutions. In this role, you'll develop comprehensive data heavy and AI applications that enhance operational efficiency across our organization. You'll work together with our Data Engineers & Analysts to create seamless, integrated systems that drive productivity and innovation. Experience in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is a plus but not required.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Data/AI Application Development:
+ Design, develop, test, and deploy full stack data heavy and AI applications that streamline business processes.
+ Integrate AI models with both front-end and back-end systems to ensure robust and user-friendly applications.

* Collaboration & Integration:
+ Work closely with the Data & Insights Team to translate business process into effective data and AI-driven solutions.
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of applications with existing systems.

* Innovation & Continuous Improvement:
+ Research and implement cutting-edge AI technologies and frameworks to drive continuous improvement.
+ Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in AI and full stack development.

* Optional Chatbot Development:


 Utilize experience (if applicable) in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots to enhance customer interaction channels.
   

  

**What We Want From You**
 For us, it is equally important to find the right fit on an interpersonal level between us and a new colleague as it is to find someone with the right experience and competence. Successful candidates also meet the following requirements
   

  

* Technical Expertise:
* Proven experience as a Fullstack Developer with a focus on AI and machine learning applications.
* Strong proficiency in Frontend and Backend technologies (e.g., JavaScript, Python, etc.).
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization tools is highly desirable.
* Experience with AI & ML frameworks (LangGraph, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, etc.) and RESTful API design.
* Collaborative Skills:
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.
* Strong communication skills to clearly articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Preferred Qualifications:
* Experience in developing enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is an added advantage.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *Inclusion and Non-Hierarchy* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 100 000 consumers.

title: Lead Software Engineer, Back End - L5 (Bangkok based - Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back-End Engineering department, we build scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. We employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques to ensure everything works without downtime. Our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. We use modern languages like Kotlin and Scala, Data technologies Kafka, Spark, MLflow, Kubeflow, VastStorage, StarRocks and agile development practices. Most importantly, we hire great people from around the world and empower them to be successful.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back End Engineering department, we build the scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. These mission-critical systems change frequently with dozens of releases per day, so we must employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques in order to make sure everything works without any downtime. We also ensure that our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. In order to accomplish this, we use state-of-the-art languages like Scala and Go, data technologies like Kafka and Aerospike, and agile development practices. Most importantly though, we hire great people from all around the world and empower them to be successful. Whether it’s building new projects like Flights and Packages or reimagining our existing business, you’ll make a big impact as part of the Back End Engineering team.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**In this Role, you'll get to:**
* Architecting and developing highly scalable, mission critical back end systems
* Owning a big chunk of Agoda’s system all the way from the north-star & vision down to the bytecode level
* Enabling impactful collaboration and cross-team projects on big projects, making a dent in the quality of our services, code & architecture
* Providing thoughtful feedback, nurture an inclusive engineering environment, and champion engineering fundamentals. Bring out the best from your fellow engineers.
* Identifying and implementing opportunities for optimization across the technology stack, focusing on cost, efficiency, velocity & dev happiness
* Exhibiting technical leadership throughout the broader organization, conveying complex technical trade-offs to non-techies such as business owners & C-suite executives.


**What you'll Need to Succeed:**
* Overall experience of 10+ years in software engineering roles
* Proven hands-on experience, Experience with owning production services with significant impact on design, development, deployment, monitoring & evolution
* Curiosity, staying a-breast on technological improvements and open source advancement.
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Kotlin, Scala, Java, C#.
* Can perform deep research & take decisions on complex projects. Can easily toggle between running as a lone wolf and also works great as part of a pack
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical details to stakeholders at all levels.
* On top of being an expert in Back End, has understanding of challenges and trade-offs in the entire engineering universe, from Front End/ Mobile to Data Analytics
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand. (Relocation package is provided)**
 #Bengaluru #Hyderabad #SouthKorea #Berlin #London #Pakistan #Pune #SanFrancisco #SanJose #Seattle #TelAviv #Jakarta #Colombia #NewYork #Vietnam #Russia #Madrid #SaoPaulo #Noida #Toronto #Chennai #Singapore #Ukraine #UAE #Sunnyvale #BuenosAires #Austin #Barcelona #Nigeria #Mumbai #Paris #Egypt #Stockholm #Amsterdam #Romania #Serbia #NewDelhi #MountainView #Chile #Warsaw #Sydney #Bangladesh #Peru #SantaClara #Chicago #Gurgaon #Munich #Montreal #Bangkok #IT #4 #5
   

  

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
* LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/agoda
* YouTube https://www.youtube.com/agodalife


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our team and help build the internal tools, APIs, and integrations that power our organization. You’ll work with a modern tech stack centered around C#, PostgreSQL, and our Azure-based platform, contributing to systems that are critical to our operations and developer experience. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys solving real-world problems through clean, maintainable code and has a strong sense of ownership and collaboration. You will join a highly competent high-performance team, and must be comfortable working in an agile and dynamic organization.
 



  





 We offer a unique opportunity to work with charging infrastructure in the Nordics and in a company that values development and sustainable growth. Here, you will have the opportunity to put your knowledge to great use while working in an environment that will shape the future of electric mobility.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 



* Design, develop, and maintain internal tools and APIs using C# and .NET.
* Build and manage integrations between internal systems and third-party services.
* Collaborate with platform and infrastructure engineers to ensure seamless deployment and scalability.
* Write clean, testable, and well-documented code.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and technical planning.



  





**Success factors** 



* Strong experience with C# and .NET Core.
* Solid understanding of relational databases, especially PostgreSQL.
* Familiarity with Azure services (App Services, Functions, Key Vault, etc.
* Experience building and consuming RESTful APIs.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and version control (e.g., Git)
* Understanding of software design principles and patterns.
* Experience with unit testing and test automation frameworks.
* Familiarity with message queues or event-driven architecture is a plus.
* Some practical experience with modern UI frameworks like React or Angular is a plus.



  





 We think that you thrive in a collaborative environment where teamwork and knowledge sharing come naturally. You take initiative and ownership of your work, and you balance ambition with a pragmatic mindset — finding solutions that work in practice, not just in theory. You communicate clearly, making complex technical concepts easy to understand, and you’re driven by curiosity — always eager to learn and stay up to date with new technologies. We believe that the right candidate has a genuine interest in the green shift, and is either already driving an EV or is very interested in doing so in the near future.
 



  





**What can we offer?** 




 We offer you a role within a team advancing sustainable transportation and creating a greener future. Your work will have a direct impact on shaping the electric vehicle future. Our core values are Care, Share and Dare where we focus on building a better future in a rapidly growing business, together.
 



  





 · Subsidized EV-charging
 



 · Flexible working hours and hybrid office
 



 · Development opportunities and career opportunities
 



 · An inclusive working environment in a Nordic company
 



 · Very good pension and insurance schemes
 



 · Health Insurance
 



 · Modern and central location in Moss / Oslo / Stockholm
 



  





**Interested?** 




 Do you want to start an exciting and meaningful journey with Recharge and have a lot of fun on the way? Please apply before December 31. Interviews will be conducted continuously and the position may be filled before end of application period.
 



 Recharge values diversity. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
 



  





**Place of work:** 
 at our HQ in Moss or office in central Oslo/Stockholm. Some traveling will be required, primarily within the Nordic region. This role reports to the Head of Engineering .
 



  





**Application deadline:** 
 Please apply no later than 31-12-2025. Position open until filled. Please apply by uploading your CV and application letter through our recruitment system Nuu.
 



 Questions about the position can be directed to: Lars Maehlum, Head of Engineering: Lars.Maehlum@rechargeinfra.com or through our recruitment system Nuu.
 



  





*We do background checks on relevant candidate via our partner Semac AS.*

title: Software Engineer (Backend Product Engineer)
description:
**Why Uniplay?** 




 Uniplay is redefining how people learn and grow.
 



  





 We turn corporate training into adaptive, AI-powered games, not lessons, slides, or compliance clicks.
 



  





 Our mission is simple:
 **make corporate learning fun.** 




  





 We’re the world’s first fully game-based learning platform, agent-driven, data-powered, and hyper-personalized.
 



  





 What used to be long lessons, static, predictable, we turn into games that are fun, engaging, and rewarding.
 



  





 Work at Uniplay is fast and runs on high trust, extreme ownership, and relentless optimism.
 **We skip bureaucracy and prefer progress over process.** 




  





 We’re still early but already working with
 **global enterprises** 
 and expanding fast. Game-based learning isn’t a theory anymore – it’s outperforming traditional learning in both engagement and retention.
 



  





 If you want to help build a new category, shape a product that will reach millions, and work with a team that
 **values curiosity over titles** 
 – join us.
 



  





**Trust the fun.** 




 uniplay.io
 



  





 We’re looking for a
 **Software Engineer (Backend Product Engineer)** 
 who loves building fast, scalable systems — the kind that don’t just “work” but
 *elevate* 
 the product. If turning raw AI + data into real-time game logic sounds fun, you’ll probably love it here.
 



  





**The Role** 




 We’re looking for a Software Engineer who loves building systems that actually scale, connect and evolve.
 



  





 It’s about building a living system where humans and agents co-create in real time.
 



  





 You’ll be right at the core, connecting LLMs, orchestration layers and a fast data architecture that powers Uniplay’s adaptive learning engine.
 



  





 We’re a small, sharp team based in Stockholm with a hybrid setup of deep-focus home days and high-energy studio days.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




 Design, build, and scale the backend and infrastructure behind our AI game engine — real-time, data-driven, adaptive.
 



  





 Develop APIs and orchestration logic that connect multiple LLMs, internal agents, and external services into a unified experience.
 



  





 Collaborate with frontend, design, and AI teams to turn logic and data into fast, elegant user experiences.
 



  





 Own cloud architecture (AWS / GCP) — from deployment pipelines to performance and reliability.
 



  





 Occasionally work in the frontend (React / Next.js) to keep the full stack coherent and flowing.
 



  





 Contributing us build our agentic backbone that empowers AI-native user experiences.
 



 Ship fast, learn faster — and help define what “AI product” means in practice.
 



  





**Who you are** 




 You builds things. You have personal projects, side experiments, or AI prototypes that show your curiosity in action. You are someone who creates, not just only codes.
 



  





 Strong in backend development, APIs, data flow, and infrastructure.
 



  





 Experienced with Node.js (Python is plus), and comfortable navigating between backend and fullstack contexts.
 



  





 Experienced in functional programming — or ready to learn and apply it.
 



 Comfortable with cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure), Infra as Code (IaC) and Event-Driven Architecture.
 



 Experience building applications with foundational models (OpenAI, Claude, Gemini or similar) and how to make them part of real products.
 



  





 Structured under speed — delivers quality even when things are moving fast.
 



  





 Communicative, collaborative, and thrives in autonomous teams with shared ownership.
 



  





 Sees AI as a new co-worker, not a co-pilot.
 



  





**Practical** 



* Hybrid in Stockholm — we value hands-on collaboration and shared creative energy.



  





 Our tech stack:
 


* **Everywhere:** 
 TypeScript, Effect.js
* **Frontend** 
 : React, Next.js
* **Backend:** 
 Node.js, Python, PostgreSQL, Kafka
* **Mobile:** 
 React Native (Expo)
* **Cloud:** 
 Cloudflare, AWS, many LLM providers
* **DevOps & Tooling:** 
 Github Actions, n8n, Grafana, OTEL, infra-as-code

title: Principal Software Engineer - Full Stack (Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:** 
 The Customer Platform department is dedicated to making every customer interaction with Agoda smooth, secure, and memorable. Our vision is to build easy-to-use, high-quality platforms that inspire trust and drive innovation across the company.
   

  

 We design and deliver the core systems that support customer experiences at every stage of their journey—from secure sign-in and data protection to personalized support after booking. Our solutions empower teams across Agoda to better understand and serve our customers, whether through advanced automation, intelligent customer engagement tools, or seamless communication channels.
   

  

 With a team of nearly 150 talented professionals from diverse backgrounds, we foster a culture of collaboration, curiosity, and continuous improvement. We’re passionate about solving complex challenges and creating technology that truly makes a difference. If you’re excited by the idea of shaping the future of customer experience on a global scale, you’ll thrive with us.
   

  

**The Opportunity:** 
 The Customer Platforms engineering team at Agoda builds and maintains the core technology powering customer interactions across Agoda’s products. We ensure millions of customers enjoy seamless, secure, and personalized experiences from booking to post-stay support.
   

  

 As a Principal Full Stack Engineer, you’ll act as a key individual contributor—overseeing execution and design within the Full Stack Engineering group. You’ll focus on improving Developer Experience and removing development bottlenecks. Our fast-paced, innovative environment gives you the opportunity to drive impactful changes that optimize how Agoda’s teams build, test, and deploy software.
   

  

**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* Lead and mentor teams of talented engineer working in Customer Platform consist of Customer security such as Auth, Account Protection and Customer Experience (GPT automations, Realtime channels Voice, Chat and CRM technologies)
* Own critical projects, drive technical strategy & vision
* Collaborate with wide range of stakeholders including tech, product, security and legal
* Drive technical decisions, team health, and enable project delivery in a fast-paced environment
* Bridging the gap between Development and Operations
* Full-stack development for internal portals and tooling
* Review systems design, push for tech adoption


**What you’ll Need to Succeed** 
 :
   

  

* 10+ years of strong engineering background in backend, front end systems & proven track record of solving complex problems
* 5+ years of proven experience mentoring software engineering teams
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Kotlin, Scala, Java, C#
* Expertise in JavaScript/TypeScript plus frameworks like React.js
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical details to stakeholders at all levels
* Can perform deep research & take decisions on complex projects. Can easily toggle between running as a lone wolf and works great as part of a pack
* Experience with Kubernetes for effective container orchestration and scaling
* Deep understanding of CI/CD pipelines, automation tools, and practices relevant to machine learning


**It’s Great if you have:**
* Hands-on experience with technologies like OAuth2, OpenID Connect, SAML, MFA, Zero Trust architecture, AI/ML, Agentic systems and LLMs, Chat and Voice systems
* Master’s or Ph.D. in a technical field
* Experience in programming with Rust, C or other low-level language


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand. (Relocation package is provided)**
 #Bengaluru #Hyderabad #SouthKorea #Berlin #London #Pakistan #Pune #SanFrancisco #SanJose #Seattle #TelAviv #Jakarta #Colombia #NewYork #Vietnam #Russia #Madrid #SaoPaulo #Noida #Toronto #Chennai #Singapore #UAE #Sunnyvale #BuenosAires #Austin #Barcelona #Nigeria #Mumbai #Paris #Egypt #Stockholm #Amsterdam #Romania #Serbia #NewDelhi #MountainView #Chile #Warsaw #Sydney #Bangladesh #Peru #SantaClara #Chicago #Gurgaon #Munich #Montreal #Bangkok #IT #4 #5
   

  

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
* LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/agoda
* YouTube https://www.youtube.com/agodalife


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

description:

title: Software Engineer (Mobile + Frontend Focus)
description:
**Why Uniplay?** 




 Uniplay is redefining how people learn and grow.
 



  





 We turn corporate training into adaptive, AI-powered games, not lessons, slides, or compliance clicks.
 



  





 Our mission is simple:
 **make corporate learning fun.** 




  





 We’re the world’s first fully game-based learning platform, agent-driven, data-powered, and hyper-personalized.
 



  





 What used to be long lessons, static, predictable, we turn into games that are fun, engaging, and rewarding.
 



  





 Work at Uniplay is fast and runs on high trust, extreme ownership, and relentless optimism. We skip bureaucracy and prefer progress over process.
 



  





 We’re still early but already working with
 **global enterprises** 
 and expanding fast. Game-based learning isn’t a theory anymore – it’s outperforming traditional learning in both engagement and retention.
 



  





 If you want to help build a new category, shape a product that will reach millions, and work with a team that values curiosity over titles – join us.
 



  





 Trust the fun.
 



 uniplay.io
 



  





 We’re looking for a
 **Software Engineer (Mobile + Frontend Focus)** 
 who can make Uniplay
 *feel* 
 amazing in the hands of users. Smooth, playful, fast — the kind of app experience that people don’t just “use,” they enjoy. If you care about detail, motion, and flow, you’ll fit right in.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Build and scale the Uniplay app across
 **iOS and Android** 
 using React Native, with optional depth in Swift or Java/Kotlin.
* Work closely with our AI orchestration layer — connecting models, context rules, and real-time feedback into seamless user experiences.
* Build and experiment with
 **agentic UI patterns** 
 : adaptive feedback, human-in-the-loop prompts, safe actions, and live explainability.
* Ensure high performance and smooth UX — from model streaming and caching to telemetry and in-app analytics.
* Collaborate with the design and AI teams to create a responsive, expressive, and emotionally intelligent interface.
* Occasionally contribute to our web layer (React + Next.js) — keeping parity and flow across platforms.
* Ship experiments fast, measure results, and iterate.
* Push transitions, motion, and product feel until everything feels alive.



  





**Who you are** 



* Experienced in mobile architecture, performance, and deployment across iOS and Android.
* Deeply comfortable with React Native, plus bonus points for Swift, Kotlin, or Java.
* Familiar with React / Next.js for web and hybrid experiences.
* Strong in
 **API integration (GraphQL / REST)** 
 and comfortable with real-time or streaming data.
* Exposure to or curiosity for functional programming — or ready to learn it.
* Experience with AWS, Kafka, Postgres, or related backend stacks is a plus.
* You’ve worked at startups or product teams where speed, ownership, and adaptability matter.
* You build things — personal projects, AI prototypes, or side experiments that show curiosity in action.
* Product-minded — you care about feel, motion, and detail, not just delivery.
* Communicative, optimistic, and self-directed — thrives in small, autonomous teams with clear goals.
* Startup-minded: no politics — just teamwork, results, and progress.



  





  





**What we want to see from you.** 




  





**We care about what you’ve built, not just what you’ve worked on.** 



* Portfolio / GitHub / Projects
* Show us shipped apps, open-source repos, or side projects — ideally live or demonstrable.
* Real product experience
* Examples from startups or fast-moving teams where you built, shipped, and iterated quickly.
* Technical curiosity
* Anything you’ve explored independently — new frameworks, AI APIs, edge performance tricks, or functional patterns.
* Impact stories
* One or two examples where you solved something difficult — scaling, speed, UX performance, or complex integration.



  





**Practical** 



* Hybrid in Stockholm — we value hands-on collaboration and shared creative energy.



  





**Our tech stack:** 



* **Everywhere:** 
 TypeScript, Effect.js
* **Frontend** 
 : React, Next.js
* **Backend:** 
 Node.js, Python, PostgreSQL, Kafka
* **Mobile:** 
 React Native (Expo)
* **Cloud:** 
 Cloudflare, AWS, many LLM providers
* **DevOps & Tooling:** 
 Github Actions, n8n, Grafana, OTEL, infra-as-code

title: Core System Developer
description:
Trygg-Hansa Affinity is a division of the leading insurance group in the Nordics - Tryg. Affinity focus on add-on insurances to our partners’ core products e.g. Consumer Devices, Cancellation, ID Protection and other insurance categories with distribution partners across Northern Europe.
   

  

**The position**
 Affinity is transitioning its core system to Guidewire Cloud Insurance Suite and is seeking 2 software developers to join this transformation. As a core system developer, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain our core system. You will be part of an agile team of Software Developers and System Business Developers.
   

  

 In this position you will:
   

  

* customize and configure Guidewire Insurance Suite to meet business requirements, such as integrating with ecosystem legacy systems and ensuring data consistency.
* troubleshoot, debug, and resolve technical issues and challenges.
* participate in the full software development life cycle, from planning and design to development, testing, and deployment.
* stay up to date with industry best practices and trends related to Guidewire development, and apply this knowledge to overcome challenges such as implementing new features and maintaining system security and compliance.


 The role is placed in our modern and centrally located Stockholm office and permanent work permit in Sweden is required. We offer you a position in a well-functioning and international team of highly skilled and committed IT experts and we hope to find an equally engaged addition to the team with one of the highest job satisfaction.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To thrive in this role, we are looking for a motivated and curious IT professional who is keen to learn and willing to contribute to a commercially oriented IT team. The ideal candidate will have experience from the Insurance sector and Guidewire development, but it is not a requirement. You should possess proficient analytical and problem-solving skills and be capable of managing tasks on your own and collaboratively within a team.
   

  

 For this role, we envision that you possess:
   

  

* bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
* strong programming skills in Java or Gosu
* experience in Integrating applications by using REST API/WebServices (SOAP)
* experience in version control tool like GIT and BitBucket
* interest for Guidewire cloud solutions
* ability to think critically and a motivation to develop new skills


**Application**
 Welcome to apply via the link. As the recruitment is ongoing, please send your application as soon as possible but no later than 2025-12-01. For questions about the position, please contact recruiting manager Jasmina Suojoki Olsson on +46 70- 870 51 35 or via email jasmina.suojoki@trygghansa.se. Final candidates will undergo a background check as part of the recruitment process.
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

 We kindly decline any contact from advertisement, consultant and recruitment companies.
   

  

**Union representatives**
 Forena: Elias Bakk, elias.bakk@trygghansa.se
   

  

 Akademikerföreningen: Lena Darin, lena.darin@trygghansa.se

title: Java Software Engineer - Tink (mid level)
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.
   

  





 Tink is building an open banking platform that enables banks, fintechs and startups to develop data-driven financial services. Through one API, Tink allows customers to access aggregated financial data, initiate payments, enrich transactions and build personal finance management tools. Tink connects to more than 3,400 banks that reach over 250 million bank customers across Europe. Our solutions are ready-to-go products, each developed to solve specific problems and bring value to both businesses and their customers.
   

  





 We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our Engineering Foundations area. Engineering Foundations builds the infrastructure and services that all other teams at Tink use everyday. This is the Developer Platform that Tink’s engineers use to ship products, and we make sure they can scale in a reliable and performant way.
   

  





 The teams in Engineering Foundations have ownership of common infrastructure allowing teams to focus on shipping business features. Our problem domains range from message queues and observability to exposing APIs to the internet, building and testing our services as well as providing a stable and flexible runtime environment or scalable data stores.
   

  





 What you will do
   

  




* Work with high load systems with high uptime requirements.
* Work with Tink’s technologies which is mainly Java, Go, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, SQL, Datadog and much more.
* Help your and other teams think about fun things like error budgets, SLI/SLOs, service capacity planning and demand forecasting.



 What we offer you
   

  





 Tink offers you a dynamic work environment where you can grow and develop your engineering skills, with opportunities for career advancement. You will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions. This together with a team of experienced professionals who are passionate about creating products that make a difference.
   

  





 Through our yearly salary review we make sure to keep Tinkers’ salaries adjusted to market trends and inflation. Our employees don’t need to change jobs in order to get a fair salary increase. Together with your manager you will create personal development plans and review twice a year so that everyone has a chance to discuss their opportunities, growth and potential.
   

  





 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.
   

  





  

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 Basic Qualifications
   

  

 -2+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree OR 5+ years of relevant work experience.
   

  

  

  

 Preferred Qualifications
   

  

 -We are looking for a committed Software Engineer who wishes to progress your career in a fast moving, international company. You’re keen to work in a collaborative, honest and agile environment. You also invest time in your own, and the team's development to build up your overall knowledge.
   

  

 We would like you to have
   

  

 - Some experience on a similar position.
   

  

 - Backend development experience in Java or Go.
   

  

 - Experience with cloud technologies, terraform tooling and Kubernetes.
   

  

 - Experience in CI/CD is a big plus.
   

  

 - Experience with a fast-paced environment that is product centric.
   

  

 - Experience working with agile methodologies and understand the value of tracking engineering key metrics.
   

  

 You might also have experience from working with
   

  

 - Distributed systems.
   

  

 - Infrastructure as Code (we use Terraform).
   

  

 - Observability technologies (eg. Datadog).
   

  

 - SRE practices.
   

  

 - Traffic routing / Service meshes.
   

  

 - Authentication and Authorisation platforms.
   

  

  

  




**Additional Information**

  

  





 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Backend Engineer – Platform Developer Experience
description:
At Spotify, the AiKA squad is pioneering the future of AI-powered code generation and developer productivity. We build scalable backend systems that integrate Generative AI (GenAI) into engineering workflows, with a focus on Honk — our autonomous coding agent for large-scale code modifications and technology migrations.
   

  

 By joining us, you’ll help shape how developers worldwide work with AI-powered tools, streamlining workflows and enabling innovation at scale. You’ll work at the intersection of backend engineering, AI/ML, and developer tooling in a fast-moving, startup-like environment.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Build and own our autonomous coding agent, developing the backend infrastructure for our autonomous coding agent
* Integrate LLMs and agentic workflows into production systems
* Scale backend infrastructure with robust services in Python/TypeScript at enterprise level
* Design agentic workflows that understand, plan, and execute code changes across large codebases
* Enhance developer experience by integrating seamlessly with CI/CD pipelines and developer tools
* Ensure reliability and quality by delivering testable, observable, and maintainable backend code
* Drive innovation and leadership by experimenting with new AI models and contributing to technical direction


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have backend expertise with Python, Java, or TypeScript/Node.js and cloud platforms
* You understand LLMs & agentic workflows (prompt engineering, orchestration, AI tools like Copilot/Claude)
* You design scalable systems that address reliability, latency, and cost challenges in AI-powered environments
* You are experienced in DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, monitoring)
* You value code quality and own systems from design to production
* You collaborate effectively across diverse teams (AI researchers, PMs, engineers)
* You thrive in dynamic environments, learning and adapting as AI technologies evolve


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Snowflake Developer Lead
description:
**Role Overview** 




 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **Snowflake Technical Lead** 
 to guide and oversee the development, design, and architectural aspects of data solutions within our Snowflake platform. The ideal candidate will lead a team of Snowflake professionals and drive the successful end-to-end delivery of data pipelines, analytics solutions, dashboards, and reports. This role involves close collaboration with business and technical teams to translate complex requirements into scalable, high-quality data solutions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**Technical Leadership** 



* Lead the design, development, and architecture of Snowflake-based data solutions.
* Oversee end-to-end delivery of data pipelines and analytics platforms, ensuring alignment with business goals and technical standards.
* Ensure best practices in Snowflake performance tuning, optimization, and efficient data modeling.



  





**Agile Delivery & Governance** 



* Drive Agile best practices across the entire data lifecycle, including:
* Backlog grooming and prioritization
* Sprint planning and execution
* Release management
* Continuous improvement
* Maintain stakeholder alignment by facilitating clear communication and iterative delivery.



  





**Team & Stakeholder Management** 



* Manage and mentor cross-functional teams including:
* Data Engineers
* BI Developers
* Business Analysts
* Ensure timely and high-quality delivery of dashboards, KPIs, and analytical solutions.
* Act as the primary liaison between business and technical teams, translating business requirements into actionable and scalable data architectures.



  





**Strategic Contribution** 



* Contribute to data strategy, solution roadmaps, and Snowflake platform enhancements.
* Advocate for modern data engineering practices, automation, and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD).



  





**Essential Skills** 



* Strong expertise in Snowflake development, design, and architectural frameworks.
* Proven experience leading Snowflake-focused data engineering teams.
* Hands-on experience in building and optimizing:
* Data pipelines
* Data models
* ELT/ETL workflows
* Proficiency in SQL, data warehousing principles, and cloud-based data ecosystems.
* Experience in Agile methodologies and multi-team coordination.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate technical solutions into business value.

title: Embedded Developer
description:
At Sii Sweden we partner with some of the most forward-thinking companies across industries such as automotive, healthcare, life-science and banking.
 



 As an Embedded Software Developer at Sii, you won’t just write code—you’ll contribute to the success of diverse, high-impact projects that demand both deep technical knowledge and creative problem-solving; you’ll play a key role in delivering tailored solutions that meet client’s unique requirements.
 



 Joining us means working in a collaborative, consultancy-driven environment so If you're excited by challenge and the opportunity to grow alongside some of the best engineers in the field, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**Your tasks** 



* Design and implement software architecture for embedded systems
* Develop robust applications using C++ and Qt/QML for device interfaces and control logic
* Work on hardware-related programming, including device drivers
* Design, build, and debug embedded Linux environments (GNU/Linux) for various hardware platforms
* Write scripts and tools in Python (or equivalent) to support development, testing, and automation
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, QA, and UX designers
* Contribute to design reviews, documentation, and system integration activities



  





**Requirements** 



* Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
* Solid experience with C++ in embedded system environments
* Strong knowledge of Qt/QML for UI and application layer development
* Experience with GNU/Linux system development and configuration
* Hands-on knowledge of hardware-level programming
* Familiarity with scripting in Python or a similar language
* Proficiency in embedded systems architecture and real-time constraints
* Ability to debug complex software/hardware interactions

title: Cloud SW Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for cloud software development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Cloud Software Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Here, you’ll thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What would you do as a** 
**Cloud Software Developer**
 You would develop web applications for configuring and operating our wireless locks and systems. Your primary focus would be on cloud front-end development, while also contributing to back-end functionality.
   

  

 You would be part of a cross-functional, agile software team that includes mobile and cloud developers, QA specialists, and a UX designer. Collaboration with our firmware team would be essential to understand device functionality and communication. Additionally, you would work closely with product management to support and enhance the cloud software application.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, creating specifications, and breaking down implementation work into epics and user stories.
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Participate in end-user testing activities.
* Continuously explore, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in software development, including a minimum of 2 years working with Angular.
* Hands-on experience with backend development, preferably in Go (Golang), and familiarity with RESTful APIs and cloud service integrations.
* Knowledge of test automation tools such as Jest, Playwright, or Cypress, and experience with CI/CD practices using Git.
* A background in Agile Scrum development and strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* A technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; a Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred.


 Ideally, you would have experience with several of the following: AWS development (e.g., Lambda, S3, CloudFront), headless CMS—preferably Sanity, AI tools like Cursor and Copilot for code development, and Agile methodologies such as SAFe.
   

  

 You’re a proactive and open-minded individual who takes initiative and enjoys learning. As a natural problem solver, you focus on solutions rather than obstacles. You thrive in cross-functional teams, value collaboration, and are always ready to support others while also seeking help when needed. You share our belief in lean and agile principles and enjoy working in an environment where diverse expertise comes together to drive successful outcomes.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* A benefits package.
* A dynamic and inclusive work environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact in attracting and retaining top talent.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
