 Who are we?
   

  

 The RiskPoint Group is a global Managing General Underwriter (MGU) providing best-in-class insurance solutions backed by the insurance companies we represent.
   

  

 We are an agile company with strong cross-border collaboration, leveraging our extensive, international expertise.
   

  

 Our company structure is flat, and we provide great opportunities for every employee to make a difference, take responsibility, enhance their skill set, and grow.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our HR department was established in 2021, as we grew past 100 employees across 10 countries. Today, our multi-national HR department provides services for 18 countries spanning Europe, the Americas, and Asia Pacific. With a growing number of over 300 employees and new operations on the horizon, we are looking to strengthen and develop our HR department to support the company’s continued growth.
   

  

 Our HR team operates as an internationally decentralized model, designed to represent the diverse and global nature of our company. Remote work collaboration between team members, regular travel, and proactive communication across geographies are essential to our team’s success.
   

  

 We work closely with all areas of the company, including our Centers of Excellence, Country Management, Finance & Operations, Marketing & Communication, and various insourced and/or outsourced partners.
   

  

**About The Position**
 As our new HR Operations Advisor, Nordics, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the company’s growth and strengthening best practices that position us as an Employer of Choice, aligning with our Group company culture.
   

  

 Our Nordic operations aim to provide the business with effective and compliant payroll & employment law administration across three of the Group’s Nordic operations in Norway, Sweden, and Finland. You will work closely with our HR Operations position covering equivalent activities for local and head office operations, based out of our Copenhagen office.
   

  

 The key focus areas for this regional position are broad, yet critical, to the fast-growing environment in which we operate. As such, you will be responsible for several areas, with examples of your responsibilities including:
   

  

**Payroll Administration**
* Process end-to-end payroll for employees in the Nordic region, ensuring precise calculation of salaries, taxes, social security contributions, and benefits. This includes accurate and timely handling of pre- and post-payroll administration for wages and additional compensation elements (such as benefits and cash perks) to meet administrative needs and comply with relevant employment laws, tax regulations, and social security requirements.
* Obtain a good understanding of international payroll matters as support to the team
* Manage the relation & communication with external providers, such as payroll, legal, and tax
* Maintain up-to-date records to ensure accurate compensation and legal statements
* Prepare the necessary elements for accounting and cash payments
* Collaborate with the Finance team to process reconciliation
* Assist with the setup of related processes and formalities for new legal entities and employees
* Support the HR Reward team with formalities in Nordic languages related to employee benefits and special tax status applications, and tax returns for international payrolls


**Personnel administration & employment law** 
  

  

* Draft and maintain all administrative employment documents in accordance with social legislation (e.g. employment contracts, addenda, transfers, and certificates
* Maintain up-to-date personnel employment data and prepare regulatory reporting
* Administration for:
+ 
- Time & attendance
- GDPR-related administration (e.g. consents, NDA’s)
- Disability and accident files – both workplace and private
- Social security & immigration formalities

* Support business managers from a technical employment and legal perspective when dealing with sensitive employee discussions related to performance management and terminations


**Regulatory**
* Actively keep abreast of developments on regulatory matters (legal/tax/payroll) for the region in scope and share the information with all stakeholders concerned
* Assist with the update of social documentation, including working regulations, contract templates, personnel handbooks, and employment-related policies


**Communication & reporting**
* Contribute to internal HR communications related to payroll and individual employee files (e.g. absenteeism, leave of absence, parental leaves, pay slips, etc.)
* Prepare data for employment and payroll audits, and management reporting
* Provide quality service advice and information to employees on social and salary matters
* Train employees and managers in the use of specific software & tracking processes for time and attendance, holidays, and sick leave, as well as on social law applicable for the region in scope


**Projects & HR team support**
* Contribute to HR projects such as payroll provider changes, HRIS, new payroll & employment set up, legal changes, leave administration, and more
* Act as an active back up for your Danish HR Operations Advisor and incidentally for other HR team members on general matters in the event of absence


 This role will ideally be based out of our Oslo office, or potentially Stockholm, allowing for partial remote work and involving regular travel to other countries. You will directly report to our Group Human Resources Director, with a dotted line to the local Country Manager.
   

  

 A great match for us
   

  

 We are looking for a trustworthy team player, able to work independently in a systematic, quality-focused, and extremely organized approach.
   

  

 This position requires the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining an overall perspective, as well as a strong willingness to learn quickly and handle complex payroll calculations and data with accuracy. You will need to perform effectively under pressure, meet challenging deadlines, and manage demanding projects, all while demonstrating strong problem-solving skills. A keen orientation toward figures, and a commitment to data accuracy and quality work are needed, together with proactive follow-through, reliability toward customers, and a readiness to act on commitments are essential.
   

  

 Given the international scope of the role, dedication and flexibility in working hours are required. The complexity of our business and the need for fast response times call for persistence and initiative. As you will be accountable for payroll matters, your presence during payroll periods each month is critical to ensuring the smooth and timely delivery of results.
   

  

**We hope you have:**
* Skills equivalent to a bachelor’s degree, or 8-10 years relevant working experience specifically in payroll and employment law matters
* In-depth knowledge of social security, tax, and social legislation for the countries in scope
* Familiarity with global mobility concepts, including expatriate taxation and cross-border employment
* Impeccable ability to deal with confidentiality, highest integrity, and ethical standards
* Maturity and personal understanding to deal with people and compensation matters in a neutral and impartial way
* Proficiency in relevant IT tools such as payroll systems, HRIS systems, and advanced Office 365
* Previous experience with project management
* Understanding of, or interest in, the insurance business, as well as several related HR domains such as employee benefits
* Interest in keeping abreast with new regulatory changes and best practices in the field
* Full written and oral proficiency in both English and Norwegian
* A good understanding of Swedish and Danish is vital for the ability to draft legal documentation in those languages. Finnish is a bonus.


 The most important attribute is your attitude and dedication to the job and to feel at home in an informal, entrepreneurial company culture where tools, structures, and processes are still under construction.
   

  

 Please note that all international candidates must have valid residency and work permits for Norway in place before applying, including a Norwegian ID (Norsk identifikasjonsnummer) to be able to process employment matters with the local Norwegian regulator.
   

  

 Interested in the position?
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your resume and cover letter of application. Please use the application form below and send your CV in English.
   

  

 We hope to see your application by November 28th, 2025.
   

  

 For more information about the position, contact, Samantha Whitmore, HR Talent Advisor at \*protected email\*. Please note that we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

**About The RiskPoint Group**
 The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe’s largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.
   

  

 With 275+ employees and 16 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.
   

  

 The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd’s of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.

title: Revenue Cloud Account Executive
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.
   

  

 Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.
   

  

**Cloud Account Executive – Revenue Cloud | Sweden**
**Powering the Future of Revenue Operations**
 Revenue management is more complex than ever, with businesses navigating
 **subscription models, usage-based pricing, and intricate deal structures** 
 .
 **Salesforce Revenue Cloud** 
 is the industry-leading solution that helps companies unify their revenue processes—
 **from Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) to Billing, Revenue Recognition, and Subscription Management** 
 —all on the world’s #1 CRM.
   

  

 As businesses embrace digital-first sales strategies, Revenue Cloud enables them to
 **close deals faster, automate revenue workflows, and gain real-time visibility into their financials** 
 . By eliminating manual inefficiencies and driving data-driven decision-making, Revenue Cloud empowers organisations to scale and optimize their revenue streams with
 **speed, accuracy, and compliance** 
 .
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced
 **Account Executive** 
 to help drive adoption of Revenue Cloud across Sweden, working with some of the most ambitious companies in the market. This is an opportunity to work at the forefront of digital transformation and revenue optimisation, partnering with
 **C-suite leaders** 
 to solve their most critical challenges.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own the full sales cycle—prospecting, strategy, and closing
* Act as a trusted advisor, guiding customers through complex revenue operations transformations.
* Engage C-level executives in meaningful conversations about modernizing revenue management with automation and AI.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to showcase the power of Revenue Cloud and the wider Salesforce ecosystem.
* Exceed sales targets while building lasting relationships that drive customer success.


**What We’re Looking For**
* SaaS Sales Expertise – A proven track record in CPQ, billing, or revenue operations solutions.
* Enterprise Sales Experience – Skilled in managing complex deals with multiple stakeholders.
* Strategic Thinking – Ability to drive high-impact discussions on revenue transformation and digital sales.
* Excellent Communication – Strong storytelling, negotiation, and closing skills.
* Industry Knowledge – Understanding of subscription models, B2B sales cycles, and revenue management trends.
* Bonus: Experience with Salesforce ecosystem solutions like Data Cloud or Marketing Cloud.


**Why Join Salesforce**
* Innovative Culture: Be part of a company that's reshaping the future with advanced AI models and cloud solutions
* Global Impact: Contribute to products that are transforming industries worldwide
* Career Growth: Access to professional development opportunities, mentorship programs, and a clear path for advancement
* Benefits & Perks: Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including competitive compensation, health benefits, education reimbursements, family-first policies, wellness programs, and more


 Unleash Your Potential
   

  

 When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and
 *be your best* 
 , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can
 *do your best* 
 . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Sales Executive
description:
**Hilton Stockholm Slussen is recruiting for a Sales Executive with the focus on corporate business to expand our Commercial team with someone who thrives on winning the business and has a passion for hospitality. Hilton is a world leading hotel company with over 9000 hotels in more than 140 countries. Hilton Stockholm Slussen is a full-service hotel located with a view over the old town. In addition to the 289 guest rooms and large meeting facilities, we operate two F&B outlets and our auditorium as an event location.**
 Do you enjoy the combination of relationship building, proactive sales and sales administration? We believe you have started your sales career and are ready for your next challenge. Don’t hesitate to apply!
   

  

 You will proactively support and be responsible for the growth of corporate account portfolio and market share by attracting new business opportunities on a local and international level. Analytical skills as well as drive and passion for people and guest service are the key to success in this role.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities:**
* Administrate and manage a portfolio of corporate accounts and actively engage with customers to grow share of the accounts along with key sales strategies.
* Analyses of local market trends and competitor activity to identify new business leads
* Together with the Director of Sales you will develop customer accounts within the local area to drive business and to increase market share in all revenue streams.
* Negotiate room rates/packages and contracts with corporate clients
* Produce accurate and timely sales reports.
* Cooperate with other departments in the hotel to create an exceptional guest experience and build strong comprehensive sales programs
* Take part in marketing initiatives to attract customers on a local and international level
* Participate in sales calls, trade shows, workshops, host site inspections and develop sales activities.
* Deliver and bring ideas of new activities for our loyalty program (Honors) to create awareness within the local market.
* To analyze and set action plans how to influence TMC’s (Travel Management Companies) by Business Intelligence/Hotel Market Data & analysis tool.


**Qualifications - What are we looking for?**
 You have 1+ years’ prior work experience within corporate sales in an international environment. Preferably within the hospitality and/or travel industry.
   

  

 A university or similar education degree within sales and marketing.
   

  

 You have a proven good ability to analyze reports and figures to set strategies. As well as a positive mindset with a proactive way of working and leading yourself.
   

  

 We are looking for an outgoing person who has a natural ability with public speaking. Someone who can make connections and maintain business relationships. A person who acts as ambassador representing our hotel and our brand at various sales fairs, events and presentations.
   

  

  

  

 You are fluent and confident in spoken and written business language in Swedish and English.
   

  

 You will need to be able to use a computer as a working tool with knowledge of excel and related programs.
   

  

 Starting date: As soon as possible
   

  

**What will it be like to work for Hilton?**
 Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodation, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.
   

  

 Our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all! Thrive at Hilton is our Team Member Value Proposition. It supports the well-being and performance of our Team Members with industry-leading benefits, recognition and support to meet your professional needs. We are committed to creating a diverse environment where every team member can thrive and be their authentic self.
   

  

 Hilton Stockholm Slussen is certified through Great Place to Work Sweden 2025 for our award-winning culture, benefits and team member engagement.
   

  

 As a Hilton team member you will enjoy access to GO Hilton, team member travel program with discounted rates at hotels all over our beautiful world.
   

  

 Other team member benefits offered at Hilton and Hilton Stockholm Slussen includes:
   

  

* Hilton University courses including career development programs such as Harvard for your development.
* Access to ComPsych Employee Assistance Program with free local counselling for mental wellness, family and other personal problem as well as support with financial advice
* Local health insurance
* Local pension benefits
* Free access to the local gym
* Parental Pay


**Work Locations**
 Hilton Stockholm Slussen Hotel
   

  

**Schedule**
 Full-time
   

  

**Brand**
 Hilton Hotels & Resorts
   

  

**Job**
 Sales

title: Industry Architect - Life Sciences
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.
   

  

 Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.
   

  

**Industry Architect, Life Sciences**
 Salesforce is transforming how Life Sciences organizations deliver therapies and support patients. With Agentforce Life Sciences, we combine deep industry expertise with the scalability of the Salesforce platform to enable compliant, customer-centric solutions across Pharma, Biotech, and MedTech.
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Life Sciences Industry Architect** 
 who can combine technical excellence, regulatory awareness, and industry depth to design robust solutions that drive trust and adoption across the life sciences value chain.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Architecture Leadership
+ Serve as the technical authority for Agentforce Life Sciences implementations across Northern Europe.
+ Define reference architectures that integrate Salesforce core and Agentforce Life Sciences capabilities with partner and ISV solutions.
+ Ensure solutions meet compliance, security, and data integrity requirements (e.g., GxP validation, 21 CFR Part 11).

* Solution Design & Delivery
+ Lead end-to-end architecture design, from discovery to blueprinting to hand-off into implementation.
+ Provide technical oversight on proof-of-concepts, pilots, and early implementations.
+ Partner with customers’ IT and enterprise architects to align Salesforce within broader enterprise architectures.

* Compliance & Validation
+ Guide customers through validation strategies for regulated systems on Salesforce.
+ Ensure design patterns support auditability, traceability, and compliance documentation.
+ Collaborate with security and regulatory experts to address regional regulatory requirements (EMA, GDPR, local data residency).

* Enablement & Advisory
+ Coach Solution Engineers and Account Teams on technical best practices and solution positioning.
+ Build technical enablement materials for field teams to accelerate adoption of Agentforce Life Sciences.
+ Act as a trusted advisor to customers’ technical leadership.


**What We’re Looking For**
**Knowledge & Expertise**
* Deep expertise in life sciences processes across commercial, medical, and R&D functions.
* Strong Salesforce platform and Life Science architectural knowledge.
* Understanding of enterprise integration patterns, APIs, and data orchestration.
* In-depth knowledge of regulatory requirements impacting life sciences IT systems (GxP, validation, audit, privacy).


**Skills**
* Strong architecture design and solution blueprinting skills.
* Technical gravitas in engaging with CIOs, CTOs, and enterprise architects.
* Ability to balance compliance and scalability in solution designs.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Experience**
* 8–10+ years of enterprise architecture or solution architecture experience.
* Hands-on experience designing validated solutions in Pharma/MedTech.
* Track record of leading complex, multi-stakeholder technology programs.
* Exposure to ISVs and partner ecosystems supporting Life Sciences.


**Why Join Salesforce?**
* Innovative Culture: Be part of a company that's reshaping the future with advanced AI models and cloud solutions
* Global Impact: Contribute to products that are transforming industries worldwide
* Career Growth: Access to professional development opportunities, mentorship programs, and a clear path for advancement
* Benefits & Perks Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including well-being reimbursement, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more


 Unleash Your Potential
   

  

 When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and
 *be your best* 
 , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can
 *do your best* 
 . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Team coach/Project Manager
description:
**Till vår kund söker vi nu en Team coach/Project Manager.** 




  





**Om uppdraget:** 




 Som Team coach kommer man att coacha och stötta två team med blandade specialistkompetenser. I rollen som Team coach är du ansvarig för arbetsflödet och tillämpningen av agilt arbetssätt och att vidareutveckla teamen. Tillsammans säkerställer ni utveckling och förvaltning av IT-miljöer på ett säkert och effektivt sätt där ni arbetar enligt DevOps principer.
 



  





 Vi söker en person som har en god förmåga att bemöta och samarbeta med olika typer av människor. Som är strukturerad och tycker om att hålla ordning och reda. Du behöver vara kommunikativ och analytisk, kunna se saker i sitt sammanhang och är inte rädd för att komma med nya idéer. Du behöver ha en bredare teknisk IT-kunskap för att snabbt komma in i, och vara delaktig i det arbete som teamet gör.
 



  





**Krav:** 



* Flera års arbetslivserfarenhet i ledande roll som Team Coach och/eller Scrum master
* Goda IT-kunskaper och erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt inom drift och förvaltning
* Erfarenhet av DevOps och ITIL
* God förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med ServiceNow och Jira.



  





  





**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm/Linköping
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
 



**Start:** 
 2026-01-08
 



  





**Ansök senast 2025-11-20** 



* **Säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll utförs på kundens begäran.**
* **I denna roll kan tjänsteresor inom Sverige förekomma.**
* **Urval av kandidater sker löpande och annonsen kan tas bort tidigare.**



  





**Om Agiremus** 




 Sedan 2015 har vi hjälpt flertalet medarbetare att komma ut på arbetsmarknaden samt att nå sina karriärmål runtom i Sverige. Genom att skapa och bibehålla meningsfulla relationer med våra samarbetspartners kan vi presentera en bred rad av arbetsmarknadens mest attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för våra medarbetare och kandidater. Agiremus verkar inom de flesta branscherna, både inom privat och offentlig sektor.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder:
 



 Agiremus erbjuder dig som konsult en spännande och utmanande arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att utvecklas inom din roll. Vi bryr oss om dig som och strävar efter långsiktiga samarbeten. Som konsult hos oss ges du, förutom spännande uppdrag, möjlighet att dela din resa med andra konsulter. Med jämna mellanrum anordnar vi tillfällen för er att träffas genom olika aktiviteter. Självklart kommer du även att ha en engagerad kontaktperson hos oss som finns där som bollplank och stöd. Vi erbjuder dig även goda personalförmåner som:
 



  




* Anställning med fast månadslön.
* Semester enligt semesterlagen.
* Tjänstepension.
* Heltäckande sjuk och olycksfallsförsäkring dygnet runt, årets alla dagar.
* Friskvårdsbidrag m.m.



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Hälsoinformatiker - Gör skillnad, växla roller, väx som expert
description:
Hälsoinformatiker - Gör skillnad, växla roller, väx som expert
   

  

 Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker en hälsoinformatiker med några års erfarenhet inom hälso- och sjukvård. Du har nyfikenheten och viljan att fortsätta växa. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i vårt snabbt växande e-Hälsoteam och bidra till att forma framtidens digitala vård.
   

  

 Ingen dag är den andra lik. Hos oss slipper du ekorrhjulet. Du får vara med där det händer – i projekt som utmanar, utvecklar och förändrar vården på riktigt.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som hälsoinformatiker är du en viktig del i arbetet med att utveckla och förbättra CGIs erbjudanden inom hälsoinformatik och stötta vid upphandlingar inom e-hälsa. Du kommer även att arbeta i uppdrag där du får kombinera din tekniska kompetens, din förståelse för vårdens processer och förmågan att driva förändringar i komplexa verksamheter. Du fungerar ofta som en brygga mellan vårdverksamhet, IT-leverantörer och andra intressenter – med målet att skapa bättre vård genom smarta digitala lösningar[HH1] .
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Du har erfarenhet av hälso- och sjukvård och en förståelse för de utmaningar och möjligheter som digitaliseringen innebär. Du är en driven och ansvarstagande person som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du vill ta plats i ett team där du får testa olika roller inom ditt område. Du har tidigare arbetat med projekt inom hälso- och sjukvården, med exempelvis fokus på informationshantering, systemintegration eller digital transformation.
   

  

 Du drivs av att förbättra vårdens informationsflöden och att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad - för patienter, vårdpersonal och samhället i stort. Du har ett analytiskt sinne, har arbetat tvärprofessionellt och har lätt för att kommunicera både med tekniska specialister och verksamhetsnära användare.
   

  

 För denna roll ser vi gärna att du har:
   

  

* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift. We only accept applications in Swedish.
* En akademisk utbildning inom Hälsoinformatik
* Erfarenhet från hälso- och sjukvårdssektorn
* Kunskap gällande informationsstandarder såsom OpenEHR, FHIR m.fl.
* Insikt i begreppssystem och klassifikationer som ICD-10, Snomed CT, m.fl
* Kompetens inom UML- och BPMN-modellering


 Meritererande är:
   

  

* Tidigare erfarenhet av kliniskt arbete inom Hälso- och sjukvård
* Tidigare arbetat med begreppssystem och klassifikationer
* Erfarenhet av projektledning, kravställning och verksamhetsanalys
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med journalsystem, LIMS/LIS, beslutsstöd eller andra vårdnära IT-system.
* Erfarenhet av nationellt och internationellt samarbete inom informatikområdet
* Certifieringar inom OpenEHR, Snomed CT och HL7/FHIR
* Trivas i att arbeta i växlande roller.


 Placeringsort
   

  

 Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö eller något av våra andra kontor i mellersta/södra Sverige
   

  

 Arbetsmiljö och sammanhang
   

  

 Vi på CGI tror att vi når längre om vi trivs ihop och jobbar tillsammans. Varje dag stöttar vi varandra, våra kunder och bygger framtiden tillsammans. I det nationella e-hälsoteamet drivs vi av visionen att hjälpa offentlig och privat hälsa, vård och omsorg för att skapa bättre utfall för både individen och organisationen. Därutöver vill vi bidra till en positiv samhällsutveckling genom att vara en komplett partner så att Sverige på bästa sätt tillvaratar digitaliseringens möjligheter.
   

  

 Digitaliseringen inom vård och hälsa ger enorma möjligheter men tekniken måste anpassas till de sammanhang där den ska göra nytta.Tillsammans med våra partners stöttar vi våra kunder med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och tjänster inom bland annat avancerad medicinsk bilddiagnostik, smarta sjukhus, datadriven sjukvård och AI.
   

  

 Övrigt om rollen
   

  

 Resor ingår i rollen, även om väldigt stor del av verksamheten numera sker digitalt. Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
   

  

 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.Mer information om några av våra förmåner:
   

  

* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


 Vill du veta mer?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Om du undrar över något, skicka gärna dina funderingar till Fredrik Augustsson: Fredrik.Augustsson@cgi.com
   

  

 Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Agil Coach
description:
Till Svenska kraftnät söker vi nu en
 *Agil Coach* 
 , kompetensnivå 5 (15+ år, Expert)
   

  

**Bakgrund och Uppdragsbeskrivning**
 Svenska Kraftnät står inför en agil förändringsresa av IT-divisionens arbetssätt. I nuläget används projektstyrningsmetoden PPS och förvaltningsmodellen Pm3. Dessa metoder kombineras med agila arbetssätt idag på flera ställen i organisationen, men inte på ett samordnat sätt över hela IT-divisionen. För att få öka vår effektivitet vill vi nu steg för steg öka vår grad av agilitet och tvärfunktionellt samarbete mellan avdelningar, enheter och team och vill därför anlita en agil coach som ska verka på strategisk nivå
   

  

**Roll och ansvar**
 Som agil coach på strategisk nivå är du en nyckelperson i IT-organisationens förändringsresa mot att skapa ett mer agilt arbetssätt. Du coachar ledningsgrupper, utvecklar agila strategier och säkerställer att det agila ramverket är anpassat till organisationens affärsmål och kultur. Ditt arbete ska ge långsiktig effekt på organisationsstruktur, ledarskap och värdeskapande och du har ett långsiktigt strategiskt ansvar för utvecklingen inom området.
   

  

**I uppdraget ingår bland annat följande arbetsuppgifter**
* Coacha och stötta ledningsgrupper, mellanchefer och andra nyckelpersoner på IT i agilt ledarskap.
* Driva och facilitera arbetet med att analysera nuvarande arbetssätt och ta fram agila strategier och förändringsplaner som ökar IT-organisationens effektivitet och förbättrar det tvärfunktionella samarbetet.
* Säkerställa att agila metoder (t.ex. SAFe, LeSS, Scrum@Scale, Spotify-modellen) anpassas till verksamhetens behov.
* Leda förändringen och den kulturella omställningen.
* Identifiera hinder på organisatorisk nivå och facilitera lösningar.
* Utvärdera och förbättra den agila mognaden i IT-organisationen.
* Utbilda i agila metoder, mindset och principer

title: Influencer Marketing Strategist
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as* 
*P&G, Disney, H&M, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024, 2025), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
 As
 **Influencer Marketing Strategist** 
 , you will have overall responsibility for developing and leading influencer strategies with a strong focus on driving business value and elevating creative standards. You will be a key player in ensuring that our influencer initiatives are innovative, effective, and seamlessly integrated into the broader communication strategy. This role carries a special responsibility for raising the creative level across the department by inspiring, challenging, and driving creative processes.
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Influencer Marketing and work closely with client teams, creators, and strategic partners to identify new opportunities, trends, and formats that strengthen brands and deliver measurable results.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Main Responsibilities Include:**
* Strategic Leadership: Develop and implement influencer strategies that are both business-driven and creatively ambitious.
* Creative Excellence: Ensure all influencer activities maintain high creative standards and contribute to the department’s overall creative development.
* Product & Format Development: Identify and develop new influencer formats, platforms, and partnerships.
* Team Leadership: Inspire and coach the team to enhance skills and creativity within influencer marketing.
* Client Engagement: Participate in strategic meetings, pitches, and onboarding of new clients with a focus on influencer solutions.
* KPI & Performance Tracking: Define goals and monitor results for influencer initiatives, optimizing based on insights and trends.
* Trend Monitoring: Stay updated on platforms, creative trends, and influencer marketing regulations.


**Organizational Placement**
* Reports to Head of Influencer Marketing.
* Collaborates closely with creative teams, client leads, and external partners.
* Drives knowledge sharing and capability development within influencer marketing and creative work.


**Qualifications**
 5+ years of experience in Influencer Marketing strategy either at an agency or client side.
   

  

 Experience managing complex activations across multiple markets.
   

  

 Experience working within an international matrix organisation either as a consultant or a stakeholder is a plus.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Specialist till Rapportering & Kapitaltäckning
description:
*Är du en analytisk och noggrann person som vill arbeta nära verksamheten i en roll med stor påverkan? Vi söker nu en Specialist till Rapportering & Kapitaltäckning – en möjlighet att få en unik inblick i Avanzas verksamhet, de regelverk som styr oss som bank och försäkringsbolag, samt hur vi säkerställer korrekt rapportering till myndigheter.*
*I den här rollen är du med och bidrar till vår finansiella stabilitet genom att säkerställa att vi rapporterar rätt, i tid och enligt gällande regelverk. Du blir en viktig del av ett mindre och specialiserat team som arbetar med både analys, processförbättring och kontinuerlig utveckling av våra arbetssätt.*
**Om tjänsten**
 Som specialist arbetar du med den löpande rapporteringen till Finansinspektionen och SCB för både Avanza Bank och Försäkringsaktiebolaget Avanza Pension. Du blir en del av gruppen Rapportering & Kapitaltäckning som består av tre personer och ingår i Finance.
   

  

 I din vardag kombineras rapportering, analys och regelverksfrågor. Du ansvarar för att rapporteringen håller hög kvalitet, följer instruktioner och levereras i rätt tid. Du arbetar även med analys och beräkningar inom kapital- och likviditetstäckning, och stöttar verksamheten när nya regelverk ska införas. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med andra avdelningar som ekonomi, försäkring och IT, och du får en bred förståelse för hela Avanzas finansiella miljö. Du håller dig också löpande uppdaterad om nya regelverk och hur dessa påverkar rapporteringen.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är strukturerad, noggrann och van att arbeta mot deadlines. Du tar egna initiativ och trivs i en miljö där kraven förändras och utvecklingen går snabbt. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du kunna samarbeta och kommunicera väl med andra, och du värderar prestigelöshet och lagarbete lika högt som vi gör.
   

  

**Vi Vill Att Du Har**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet från bank, försäkringsbolag eller myndighet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Excel
* Akademisk examen inom ekonomi, redovisning eller finans
* Erfarenhet av myndighetsrapportering till Finansinspektionen


 Du får ett lärorikt och utvecklande arbete där du kan påverka och bidra med egna initiativ, samtidigt som du fördjupar dig i en kritisk del av bankens regelverksmiljö.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Skicka din ansökan, CV och personligt brev genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Skicka gärna din ansökan så snart som möjligt eftersom urval sker löpande.
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Oliver Lippman, tf. Chef för Rapportering & Kapitaltäckning, på oliver.lippman@avanza.se.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag eller annonssäljare undanbedes vänligt men bestämt.*
 Avanza är Sveriges ledande plattform för sparande och placeringar. Vi drivs av att förändra branschen genom att utmana de stora bankerna och försäkringsbolagen på den svenska sparmarknaden. Vi vill vara tjänsten som förenklar och förbättrar spararnas ekonomi, oavsett om man älskar aktier eller bara vill ha ett bra sparande. Vår vision är att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor. Därför står våra kunders bästa alltid i fokus, precis som det borde vara. Affärsidén är enkel – mer till dig, mindre till banken. En idé som gett oss Sveriges nöjdaste sparare 15 år i rad.

title: Technical Architect, Waypoint
description:
Are you passionate about making large-scale systems faster, more resilient, and smarter? Do you thrive on solving deep technical challenges that span across applications and teams? If so, we have a high-impact opportunity that puts you at the heart of our most critical tech initiatives.
   

  

 We sell safety in If—safety at home, at work, in society, and in life. Every day, we help our customers stay protected and confident, so they can explore new opportunities, start businesses, and live their lives without worry.
   

  

 To deliver on this promise, we are building Waypoint, our next-generation digital insurance platform. Waypoint involves more than 150 people and 12 cross-functional teams across the Nordics and Latvia. To achieve our ambitious goals, we are looking for an experienced Technical Architect with strong technical depth to join our Waypoint Architecture team.
   

  

**About The Team**
 You will join Waypoint Architecture, part of If’s centralized IT Architecture organization with Nordic responsibility. Our team of 13 skilled architects covers domains such as Product, Customer, Policy, Invoicing & Accounting, and Online Sales.
   

  

 Read more about our tech community: www.if.se/tech.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Technical Architect to step into the role of Performance & Reliability Lead, driving cross-cutting efforts that elevate the performance, reliability, and delivery capabilities of our Waypoint system. In this role, you’ll shape the future of our architecture, address legacy challenges, and enable continuous delivery at scale.
   

  

 As part of our architecture team, you’ll play a key role in defining the technical foundation of our solutions—ensuring they are robust, scalable, and maintainable, while aligning with our target state and supporting a coherent, future-proof application landscape.
   

  

 What You’ll Lead
   

  

* End-to-End Performance Optimization: Identify bottlenecks, profile systems, and drive improvements across the system landscape.
* Reliability & Disaster Recovery: Build resilient systems and ensure graceful degradation.
* Non-Functional Requirements: Define and uphold standards for performance, scalability, and maintainability.
* Root Cause Analysis & Early Detection: Implement tools and practices for proactive issue identification.
* Legacy System Modernization: Use AI to tackle technical debt and unlock new capabilities.
* Continuous Delivery Enablement: Champion isolated testing, synthetic data, and deployment automation.


 We offer
   

  

 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits


 Who are you?
   

  

 Your Technical Toolbox
   

  

* Deep understanding of message-based system architecture.
* Expertise performance profiling and visualization across distributed applications.
* Mastery of cross-cutting concerns: security, IoC, transaction management, caching, and scalability.
* Strong knowledge of .NET (Framework & Core) and runtime environments.
* Familiarity with AI tools for legacy systems and modernization strategies.
* Currently holding or having the ability to build broad and deep understanding of the Waypoint system architecture.


 Your Mindset & Skills
   

  

* Innovator: You challenge the status quo and bring fresh ideas to complex problems.
* Systems Thinker: You see the big picture and understand how parts interact.
* Facilitator: You guide technical decisions and align diverse stakeholders.
* Strategic Communicator: You make complex ideas clear and actionable.
* Collaborator: You work across squads, roles, and disciplines to drive change.
* Decisive: You balance trade-offs and make informed decisions that move us forward.


 Additional facts and the recruitment process
   

  

 Application deadline: Screening and interviewing will be conducted on a rolling basis. However, application deadline is 16th of November 2025.
   

 To apply for the position: Please attach your CV. Cover letter is not needed, instead we ask you to answer few questions on our application form. Please apply through our recruitment system Workday. Please notice that we are not able to process any applications outside our recruitment system. We would kindly ask you to send your application in English.
   

 Work location: Oslo, Norway or Stockholm, Sweden
   

 Travelling: Some travel within the Nordics will be required.
   

 Start: As soon as possible/by agreement.
   

  

 For more information, please contact: Arne-Morten Danielsen, +47 95141591, arne-morten.danielsen@if.no
   

  

 Recruitment agencies are kindly asked not to respond to this ad.
   

  

 Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.
   

  

 Ready to architect the future of insurance? Apply today and be part of our tech journey!
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Global Key Account Manager
description:
*Lumene Group’s vision is to be the number one beauty company from the Nordics, recognised for our leading work in circular beauty among a wide international consumer group. We are a pioneer in the circular economy and bringing the power of the wild Nordic nature to the reach of all. Lumene Group is the home for three Nordic beauty brands: LUMENE, CUTRIN and IDA WARG Beauty.* 




  





 We’re looking for a
 **Global Key Account Manager** 
 to join our Travel Retail team, responsible for developing and executing both long-term customer strategies and short-term business plans. In this role, you’ll be responsible for achieving budgeted sales and profitability targets for your customers, while driving new launches, optimizing the product portfolio, and executing consumer activity plans. We’re looking for someone who shares our passion for building long-term, profitable brand growth. As Key Account Manager, you’ll play a key role in expanding Lumene Group's Travel Retail business globally. 
 



  





 This is a full-time role located at our Espoo, Kauklahti headquarters or at our Stockholm office.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


* Develop and implement a long-term customer strategy.
* Drive the growth of the Travel Retail business, with a focus on pitching to new customers.
* Build, implement, and follow up on customer-specific business plans.
* Manage and optimize the brand portfolio.
* Monitor and report customer performance, including customer P&L.
* Track customer sell-out performance and related actions.
* Provide sales forecasts for new launches and the basic portfolio.



  





  





 You will need for succeeding
 


* Minimum 2–3 years of experience in Account Management or another commercial role.
* Proven ability to develop, implement, and follow through on customer strategies.
* You value long-term customer relationships and are a natural networker.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English; Swedish is an advantage.
* An analytical mindset and structured working habits, with the ability to organize and prioritize effectively.
* Good interpersonal skills and a strong team player.
* Experience working in a multicultural matrix organization.
* You hold a degree in business or other relevant field.
* Willingness to travel up to 25%.



  





  





 What we offer for you
 


* The opportunity to be part of a Nordic beauty company with ambitious global expansion.
* A chance to advance your expertise through impactful, strategic brand work.
* A passionate, collaborative team that thrives on beauty, innovation, and excellence.
* Flexibility to combine office and remote work.
* We offer various benefits to support your well-being and work-life balance, including comprehensive occupational health care, mental-well-being service Auntie, and well-being benefit Epassi.
* And psst. if you love our products as we do, you might want to know that our employees have the possibility to buy our products at reduced prices.



  





 Ready to take the next step in your career? We’d love to hear from you. Please submit your application and CV by November 23rd via our recruitment system. Kindly note that the interviews will be started as soon as we receive potential applications. For more information, feel free to contact Camilla Paulsson, Global Head of Travel Retail, at +358 40 5367832 during the following times: Monday, November 17th, 3–4 PM (EET) or Friday, November 21st, 9–10 AM (EET) or by email at camilla.paulsson@lumene.com. 
 



  





*Diversity and inclusion are an important part of all our work at Lumene Group. We want to invest in diverse knowledge and wisdom because it adds value to our community and business. We thrive from diversity and welcome applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, abilities, beliefs, orientations, and backgrounds.*

title: Uppdragsansvarig
description:
Svenska kraftnäts nuvarande driftövervakningssystem SCADA/EMS ska bytas ut och projektet har som mål att implementera ett nytt system.
   

  

**Roll och ansvar**
 Rollen innebär primärt att ansvara för ett av Svenska kraftnäts viktigaste projekt. Här ansvarar du för projektets planering, framdrift, samt rapportering enligt den omfattning och uppgifter som delegeras av styrgruppen och programledaren.
   

  

 Rollen arbetar främst inom ett projekt som omfattar operativ drift samt andra verksamhetsnära aktiviteter. Projektet innefattar även etablering av en IT-lösning med omfattande verksamhetstester samt driftsättning av plattformen med verksamhetens användare.
   

  

 Rollen kan även få ansvar att stödja andra projekt inom det program och/eller andra initiativ inom den verksamhet som projektet tillhör, t.ex. hjälpa till med utredningar, riskhantering, koordinering, förändringsarbete och förvaltningsarbete, kontinuitetsplanering, mm.
   

  

**Arbetet innefattar:**
* Uppdragsledning/delprojektledning
* Aktivitetsledare för projektets olika delar och leverabler, t.ex EMS-funktioner, design, konfiguration, test, driftsättning, förvaltningsetablering, utbildning, mm.
* Samverkan och stöd till omkringliggande initiativ, t.ex. programmets förändringsprojekt, linjens förvaltningsetablering, andra berörda initiativ på Svenska kraftnät, Nordiska TSO:er, etc.
* Ansvar uppdragsledning inom området EMS i ett pågående verksamhetsprojekt, med fokus att införa ett nytt SCADA/EMS-system på Svenska kraftnät
* Ansvar att bidra med domänkunskap inom SCADA/EMS, t.ex. EMS-funktionalitet, underhållsfrågor, test och acceptansförfarande i införandeprojekt, mm.
* Leverera resultat, följa upp, samt rapportera till projektledare samt berörda intressenter.
* Ge stöd och expertkunskap till andra initiativ inom programmet och linjeorganisationen på Svenska kraftnät

title: Technical Sales Executive Scandinavia (Norway, Denmark or Sweden)
description:
Join Nordcloud and be part of the European cloud revolution. We supercharge our customers to innovate in hyperscaler cloud, enabling seamless migration, advanced security, and data-driven success. This role focuses on winning new clients in the Enterprise and Corporate business sectors and develop some of our current customers in parallel. As a trusted advisor, you will develop strong relationships with C-level executives and
   

  

 stakeholders, ensuring Nordcloud becomes their go-to partner for cloud services.
   

  

**Currently, we are looking for a** 
**Technical Sales Executive – Scandinavia (Norway, Sweden, Denmark)**
 As a Technical Sales Executive at Nordcloud, you will be a driving force in our sales organisation, identifying client needs, designing cloud solutions, and managing the entire sales process. By delivering innovative cloud solutions, you will help clients increase operational efficiency and reduce costs, and ensuring that technology drives measurable business outcomes.
   

  

 Your technical acumen and consultative approach will empower you to understand complex client challenges, architect impactful solutions, and communicate the business benefits of cloud adoption to C-level and technical stakeholders.
   

  

 You will own your results, demonstrate a winner’s attitude, and collaborate closely with colleagues across Nordcloud and IBM Consulting to achieve your goals.
   

  

**Your** 
**key responsibilities:**
* Lead Technical Sales Engagements: Identify client needs and design tailored cloud solutions that deliver measurable business outcomes. Drive new business within existing client base as well as within new logo acquisitions leveraging your technical expertise, solution mindset and ability to link desired business value to technical solutions.
* Collaborate for Success: Work as part of larger teams—often led by IBM Consulting—integrating Nordcloud’s cloud solutions and value proposition into comprehensive, high-impact deals. Build strong relationships with internal teams, partners (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), and stakeholders to deliver best-in-class solutions.
* Create Business Value: Apply a solution-based sales approach to address complex customer challenges, always focusing on how technology can advance the client’s strategic objectives.
* Ownership for Results: Take full responsibility for meeting and exceeding sales targets in consultancy and service sales, with a focus on cloud infrastructure, modernization, managed services, and consulting portfolios.
* Drive and Winner’s Attitude: Approach every opportunity with energy, resilience, and a relentless drive to win. Celebrate successes and learn from setbacks, always striving for excellence.
* Solution Workshops & Discovery: Lead workshops and discovery sessions with client stakeholders to uncover pain points and co-create strategies that maximize the value of cloud adoption.
* Thought Leadership: Represent Nordcloud at industry events and in the media, showcasing your expertise and our leadership in cloud technology.


**What we are looking for:**
* Experience: 7+ years in technical sales, solution sales, IT consulting, or cloud services, with a strong technical foundation and a proven track record of winning and growing new business.
* Solution Understanding: Knowledge of public cloud architectures (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), migration strategies, and cloud-native solutions. Ability to map technology capabilities to client business needs.
* Consultative Approach: Experience working directly with C-level stakeholders and senior IT executives, translating technical concepts into business value. With solution selling methodology you will craft tailored value propositions for complex cloud projects.
* Ownership & Drive: Demonstrated ability to take ownership for results, operate with a winner’s attitude, and thrive in high-growth, fast-paced environments.
* Collaboration: Proven ability to collaborate across teams and organizations, including cloud partners, to deliver integrated solutions.
* Communication: Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent preferred.
* Languages: Fluent in English and at least one Scandinavian language.
* Bonus Points: Hands-on experience with cloud services offerings, tools, and processes. Certifications in AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud are highly valued.


 We encourage you to
 **apply** 
 , even if you don’t meet all of the requirements. We value your growth potential and enthusiasm!
   

  

**What we offer:**
* Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working model
* Laptop and equipment to enable your efficient work
* Local package such as extensive private health care and insurance, wellness benefits


 Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying.
 **All applicants must have the right to work in Sweden.**
**About Nordcloud**
 Nordcloud is a European leader in cloud implementation, application development, managed services and training. It’s a recognised cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record helping organisations leverage public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings and sustainable value.
   

  

 Nordcloud is triple-certified across Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform – with 10 European hubs, over 1,300 employees and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects for companies ranging from midsize to large corporates.
   

  

 Our clients benefit from multi-cloud expertise that guides best practices, preempts pitfalls, provides essential technical support and steers teams through cultural change. From strategy planning to application management, we take our customers through the whole cloud journey to drive real business outcomes from cloud technology.
   

  

 Learn more at www.nordcloud.com
   

  

*Nordcloud values diversity and is dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all candidates and employees.*

title: Senior Android Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Android Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Design, build & scale high-performance mobile applications using Jetpack Compose.
* Collaborate and participate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features across both platforms.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organisations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.
* Drive and lead Android projects. Be able to oversee a team of Android developers, define standards, and manage team deliveries.
* Able to either work closely with, or take part in solving problems on other platforms like iOS, cross-platform and more.
* Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends to ensure our apps are cutting-edge.
* Having a deep understanding of the mobile deployment pipeline.


**Who You Are**
* You're an Android developer (with 10+ years of experience) and a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognising the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.


**Are You Ready to Shape, Ship, and Scale with Us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Fastighetschef
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens Lidingö?
   

  

 Hos Lidingö stad får du en unik möjlighet att leda och utveckla stadens fastighetsförvaltning – i en organisation där samhällsnytta, kvalitet och innovation går hand i hand. Du får ett helhetsansvar för en omfattande och meningsfull fastighetsportfölj, samtidigt som du bidrar till att skapa värde för både medarbetare och invånare.
   

  

 Hos oss får du arbeta strategiskt och långsiktigt – men också nära verksamheten. Du blir en del av ett engagerat och samarbetsinriktat ledningsteam, där du får utrymme att påverka, driva förändring och utveckla nya arbetssätt.
   

  

 Vi satsar aktivt på din kompetens och ditt ledarskap, med konkreta möjligheter till utveckling och lärande. Vi erbjuder även flexibilitet i vardagen, friskvårdsbidrag, möjlighet till semesterväxling och närhet till både natur och skärgård – bara 15 minuter från T-centralen.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som Fastighetschef leder du strategiskt och operativt arbetet inom stadens fastighetsförvaltning. Du har ett övergripande ansvar för bostäder, samhällsviktiga lokaler såsom skolor, förskolor och äldreboenden samt fastighetsteknik och skötsel.
   

  

 Du rapporterar till förvaltningschefen och samarbetar nära med dina tre enhetschefer. Tillsammans skapar ni struktur, tydliga rutiner och effektiva arbetssätt för att säkerställa långsiktig kvalitet, hållbarhet och kundnöjdhet.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
   

  

* Leda och utveckla enheterna Bostad, Samhällsfastigheter och Fastighetsteknik, med fokus på engagemang, ansvar och utveckling.
* Driva strategisk planering och utveckling av stadens fastighetsportfölj, inklusive budget, ekonomi, struktur och processförbättringar.
* Ansvara för upphandlingar, avtalsförhandlingar och uppföljning av entreprenörer, konsulter och hyresgäster.
* Säkerställa att verksamheten bedrivs enligt lagar, regler och stadens hållbarhetsmål.


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har en relevant högskoleutbildning inom samhällsbyggnad, fastighetsförvaltning, bygg, ekonomi, juridik eller motsvarande och minst fem års erfarenhet av ledarskap inom fastighetsverksamhet.
   

  

 Du har djup förståelse för fastigheter och drivs av att kombinera strategiskt arbete med praktiskt genomförande. Du trivs med att bygga struktur, skapa ordning och driva utveckling.
   

  

 Du är en samarbetsinriktad ledare som får med dig andra genom tydlighet, engagemang och förtroende. Samtidigt har du ett nyfiket och innovativt förhållningssätt, och ser möjligheterna i digitalisering, IT och AI för att skapa moderna och effektiva lösningar.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du också har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från antingen offentlig sektor eller kommersiell fastighetsverksamhet.
* Kunskap om LOU (meriterande men inte ett krav).
* Förmåga att kombinera innovationskraft med struktur och långsiktighet.
* Intresse för att utveckla både människor, arbetssätt och teknik.


 Oavsett om du är en driven ledare tidigt i karriären som vill växa, eller en mer erfaren chef som vill bidra med din kompetens i en spännande utvecklingsfas, är du varmt välkommen att söka.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Staden tillämpar individuell lönesättning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Fastighetsförvaltningen är en av Lidingö stads sex förvaltningar med cirka 40 medarbetare. Vi ansvarar för att stadens verksamheter har ändamålsenliga, trygga och hållbara lokaler från skolor och förskolor till idrottsanläggningar och bostäder.
   

  

 Förvaltningen befinner sig mitt i en spännande förändringsresa, där du som Fastighetschef får en central roll i att forma framtidens Lidingö
   

  

 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Lidingö stad med Adecco och all kontakt hänvisas till rekryteringskonsult Anette Bergman.

title: Master's Thesis - Predictive Maintenance Using AI
description:
We are now looking for a Master’s thesis student in Data Science / Machine Learning to take this research to the next level.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Atlas Copco Industrial Technique, Nacka Stockholm
   

  

**Project:** 
 Leveraging AI for Early Detection of Maintenance Issues in Tightening Tools
   

  

 At Atlas Copco, we are continuously innovating to make industrial operations smarter and more efficient. We have developed a deep learning–based anomaly detection model capable of identifying various types of irregularities in tightening tools. This technology holds great potential to revolutionize predictive maintenance — enabling us to anticipate failures before they occur.
   

  

**Your Mission**
* Leverage and interpret the outputs from our existing anomaly detection model.
* Develop innovative methods to aggregate model outputs and related sensor data.
* Design algorithms or metrics that can predict potential maintenance issues before a tool breaks.


**What You’ll Work With**
* Real-world industrial IoT and sensor data from Atlas Copco tightening tools.
* Advanced machine learning techniques, such as gradient boosting machines and deep learning (experience with deep learning is a plus).
* Data preprocessing and cleaning for model training.
* Model evaluation, including performance metrics and loss function design.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Background in Data Science, Machine Learning, or related fields.
* Strong understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning techniques.
* Experience with Python and libraries such as scikit-learn and PyTorch.
* Curiosity, problem-solving mindset, and a drive to turn data into actionable insights.


**Duration & Start**
* Master’s thesis project
* Start: Flexible, early 2026 preferred


**Give wings to your dreams**
 The world is full of opportunities and we can’t wait for you to explore them with us. Our caring culture and leading-edge technology enables us to innovate for a sustainable future. We believe that passionate people make it happen. With us you are empowered to explore opportunities and drive your own professional journey.
   

  

 We offer a wide range of interesting job roles and many opportunities to grow. This is where it begins – Join us at the Home of Industrial Ideas.

title: Erfaren ekonom – arbeta med policy och analys på finansmarknadsavdelningen
description:
**Värdepappersmarknadsenheten, Finansmarknadsavdelningen, Finansdepartementet**
 Har du en akademisk examen med inriktning mot nationalekonomi, finansiell ekonomi eller motsvarande, och ett genuint intresse för frågor inom finansmarknadsområdet? Då kan vi erbjuda dig ett omväxlande och utvecklande arbete i händelsernas centrum, där ekonomi och politik möts.
   

  

**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Finansmarknadsavdelningen ansvarar för att ta fram underlag för regeringens politik inom den finansiella sektorn. Värdepappersmarknadsenheten är en av fyra enheter på avdelningen och ansvarar för analys, policy och lagstiftning på värdepappersmarknaden – till exempel handel med finansiella instrument, värdepappersfonder, finansiell infrastruktur och åtgärder mot marknadsmissbruk. Arbetet präglas av marknadens snabba utveckling, digitalisering och det pågående arbetet inom EU för att skapa en kapitalmarknadsunion.
   

  

 På ärdepappersmarknadsenheten arbetar ekonomer och jurister tillsammans i förhandlings-, analys- och lagstiftningsprojekt. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att vara inriktade på analys och utveckling av policy, samt förhandlingsarbete inom EU. Arbetet bedrivs stundtals i högt tempo och innebär kontakter med Finansdepartementets politiska ledning, andra departement, riksdagen, myndigheter och olika branschföreträdare. Resor inom Europa kan förekomma i tjänsten.
   

  

 Aktuella frågor på enheten är bland annat arbetet för stärkt konkurrenskraft inom EU och förslag från EU-kommissionen om ökad integration och gemensam tillsyn på värdepappersmarknadsområdet. Löpande policyfrågor handlar till exempel om finansiella stabilitetsrisker utanför banksektorn, företagsobligationsmarknadens funktionssätt, hållbarhet och digitalisering.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Du har en akademisk examen med inriktning mot nationalekonomi, finansiell ekonomi eller motsvarande. Det är meriterande om du har forskarutbildning.
   

  

 Du har minst fem års arbetslivserfarenhet från finansmarknadsavdelningens verksamhetsområde och erfarenhet av kvalificerat analysarbete, inklusive hantering av data. Det är meriterande om du har arbetat inom värdepappersmarknadsområdet, liksom om du har erfarenhet av tillsyn, övervakning, internationella förhandlingar eller normbildande arbete som bedöms relevant för enhetens uppdrag.
   

  

 Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska är en förutsättning för rollen.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 Regeringskansliets medarbetarkriterier är helhet, utveckling och resultat.
   

  

 Alla som arbetar i Regeringskansliet behöver ha helhetssyn och samarbeta för verksamhetens bästa. Du förväntas bidra med ditt perspektiv och din kompetens samt vara öppen för andras. Du kommer med idéer och nya angreppssätt för att förbättra och utveckla verksamheten och din egen kompetens. Du är inriktad på resultat i ditt agerande och anpassar dig när behov och inriktning ändras.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår verksamhet på www.regeringen.se.
   

  

 Arbetet ställer höga krav på problemlösande analysförmåga, självständighet och förmåga att driva processer framåt. Du arbetar strukturerat och tar ansvar för dina uppgifter samt är flexibel och snabb på att anpassa dig när ändrade omständigheter kräver det.
   

  

 Du har mycket god samarbetsförmåga och relaterar till andra på ett lyhört och smidigt sätt. Du är noggrann och kvalitetsmedveten, med förmåga att leverera väl underbyggda analyser inom givna tidsramar. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Övrigt**
