title: Revenue Cloud Account Executive
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category


Sales
Job Details


**About Salesforce**

Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.


Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.


**Cloud Account Executive – Revenue Cloud | Sweden**

**Powering the Future of Revenue Operations**

Revenue management is more complex than ever, with businesses navigating **subscription models, usage-based pricing, and intricate deal structures** . **Salesforce Revenue Cloud** is the industry-leading solution that helps companies unify their revenue processes— **from Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) to Billing, Revenue Recognition, and Subscription Management** —all on the world’s #1 CRM.


As businesses embrace digital-first sales strategies, Revenue Cloud enables them to **close deals faster, automate revenue workflows, and gain real-time visibility into their financials** . By eliminating manual inefficiencies and driving data-driven decision-making, Revenue Cloud empowers organisations to scale and optimize their revenue streams with **speed, accuracy, and compliance** .


We’re looking for an experienced **Account Executive** to help drive adoption of Revenue Cloud across Sweden, working with some of the most ambitious companies in the market. This is an opportunity to work at the forefront of digital transformation and revenue optimisation, partnering with **C-suite leaders** to solve their most critical challenges.


**What You’ll Do**

* Own the full sales cycle—prospecting, strategy, and closing
* Act as a **trusted advisor** , guiding customers through complex revenue operations transformations.
* Engage **C-level executives** in meaningful conversations about **modernizing revenue management** with automation and AI.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to showcase the power of **Revenue Cloud and the wider Salesforce ecosystem** .
* Exceed sales targets while building lasting relationships that drive customer success.

**What We’re Looking For**

* **SaaS Sales Expertise** – A proven track record in **CPQ, billing, or revenue operations solutions** .
* **Enterprise Sales Experience** – Skilled in managing complex deals with multiple stakeholders.
* **Strategic Thinking** – Ability to drive high-impact discussions on revenue transformation and digital sales.
* **Excellent Communication** – Strong storytelling, negotiation, and closing skills.
* **Industry Knowledge** – Understanding of **subscription models, B2B sales cycles, and revenue management trends** .
* **Bonus:** Experience with **Salesforce ecosystem** solutions like **Data Cloud or Marketing Cloud** .

**Why Join Salesforce:**

* **Innovative Culture:** Be part of a company that's reshaping the future with advanced AI models and cloud solutions
* **Global Impact:** Contribute to products that are transforming industries worldwide
* **Career Growth:** Access to professional development opportunities, mentorship programs, and a clear path for advancement
* **Benefits & Perks:** Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including competitive compensation, health benefits, education reimbursements, family-first policies, wellness programs, and more

Unleash Your Potential


When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and *be your best* , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can *do your best* . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.


Accommodations


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


Posting Statement


Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.
company_description: Salesforce is the customer company. We make cloud-based software designed to help businesses connect to their customers in a whole new way.

title: Associate ERP Consultant (Trainee) – Supply Chain Management
description:
### **General information**

Country
Sweden
City
Linkoping
Job ID
46831
Department
Infor Consulting Services
Experience Level
ENTRY\_LEVEL
Employment Status
FULL\_TIME
Workplace Type
Hybrid
### **Description & Requirements**

Are you curious about how businesses run smoothly behind the scenes? Do you enjoy problem-solving, learning, and working with people? At Infor, we’re looking for ambitious graduates to join our Trainee Program and start their career as ERP consultants, helping companies optimize their operations using our world-class Infor M3 system.


This is your chance to step into the exciting world of Supply Chain Management, gain hands-on experience with real customers, and grow into a confident ERP consultant — all while being supported by experienced mentors and a team that loves to share knowledge.

  

Location: Linköping or Stockholm | Start: September 2026

  

 What you’ll actually do


As a Trainee Consultant, your day-to-day work will be practical, varied, and hands-on. You’ll:

* Work with real ERP systems (Infor M3) – helping customers improve processes in purchasing, production, and inventory.
* Understand business processes – analyze how companies buy, produce, and deliver products, and identify ways to make it faster, smarter, and more efficient.
* Collaborate with customers – join workshops, ask questions, take notes, and make sure the solutions we implement truly solve their challenges.
* Design and document solutions – translate what you learn from customers into clear instructions for the technical team.
* Support training and go-lives – help users understand new processes and assist during system launches.
* Learn continuously – from workshops, mentors, and project experience, you’ll develop skills in business analysis, consulting, and ERP implementation.


Think of this role as hands-on learning every day, where you’ll gradually take more responsibility as you gain experience. You won’t just be observing — you’ll be contributing from day one.

  

 Who we’re looking for


We want candidates who are curious, proactive, and eager to learn. You’ll thrive in this role if you:

* Are genuinely interested in business processes, IT, and AI solutions
* Are fluent in English and Swedish - speaking and writing
* Are willing to travel occasionally
* Have an educational background or knowledge in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Manufacturing, or Information Systems
* Love collaborating with people, asking questions, and finding solutions


No prior consulting experience? No problem. If you have a desire to learn and a passion for understanding how businesses work, this role is perfect for you.  

 What we offer

* Start September 2026 with a full-time permanent contract
* A dedicated mentor to guide you through projects and learning
* Hands-on experience in real customer projects from day one
* Ongoing training in business processes, ERP systems, and consulting skills
* Work closely with experienced consultants and fellow Early Talents
* Competitive salary, hybrid work flexibility, wellness benefits, and holiday perks
* International exposure — collaborate with Early Talents from across EMEA

  

 About the Early Talent Program


The 12-month program combines classroom learning in our academy with real project work, giving you the chance to:

* Help customers implement Infor M3 solutions in industries like Distribution, Food & Beverage, and Manufacturing
* Understand both the IT and business side of ERP projects
* Develop consulting skills, soft skills, and confidence in client interactions

  

By the end of the program, you’ll have real project experience, a deep understanding of ERP systems, and the skills to become a fully-fledged ERP consultant — ready to make a difference for our customers.

  

 Ready to launch your consulting career?


If you’re curious, motivated, and excited to learn, join us at Infor and start shaping the future of digital business solutions. Apply today and step into a role where every day brings new challenges, learning, and impact!

  

  

**About Infor**  

Infor is where ambition meets impact. Join a global community of bold thinkers and innovators, where your expertise doesn’t just solve problems. it shapes industries, unlocks opportunities, and creates real-world impact for billions of people. At Infor, you’re not just building a career. you’re helping to build what’s next.  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.  

For more information visit www.infor.com  


**Our Values**  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM™. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section. **Fraud Awareness**  

We have been made aware of unauthorized individuals posing as Infor recruiters, including some who have made fraudulent offers of employment. Please read our guidelines and protect yourself from recruitment scams. **Fraud Privacy Policy**  

We value your privacy at Infor.
company_description: Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry-specific markets.

title: Cyber Security Expert
description:
As a Cyber Security Expert, you are responsible for protecting the organization’s digital assets, systems, and networks against cyber threats. You will proactively identify vulnerabilities, implement security solutions, and ensure compliance with relevant security standards and regulations.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
Develop and implement security strategies, policies, and procedures.
  
Monitor networks and systems to detect and respond to security incidents.
  
Perform risk assessments and penetration tests to identify vulnerabilities.
  
Manage incident response and coordinate actions during breaches or attacks.
  
Ensure compliance with applicable laws, standards, and frameworks (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001).
  
Conduct cybersecurity awareness training for staff.
  
Collaborate with IT teams to integrate security into all technical solutions.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Degree in IT, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
  
Strong knowledge of network security, encryption, firewalls, and IDS/IPS.
  
Experience with security tools and platforms (SIEM, antivirus, EDR).
  
Understanding of cloud security (AWS, Azure, GCP).
  
Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CEH or similar are a plus.
  
Analytical and problem-solving skills.
  
Excellent communication skills and ability to work cross-functionally.
  
  

Personal Attributes
  
Detail-oriented and thorough.
  
Proactive and solution-focused.
  
Ability to handle stress and act quickly during incidents.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
**We’re Redeploy. A tech consultancy built for people who want to grow, make a** difference and have a good time doing it.


We design, build, scale and maintain modern solutions across Cloud, Data and AI, helping ambitious companies across the Nordics transform how they work with technology. As a trusted partner to Microsoft, AWS and Databricks, we deliver platforms that are built for impact and built to last.
  

  

What sets us apart is the way we work. Curiosity runs deep here, as does the drive to keep learning and sharing. You’ll join a team that values ownership, collaboration and high technical standards, and where people genuinely care about doing things well. For our clients. And for each other.

**What you’ll do**

You’ll be part of our **Business Solutions competence area**, where we help organizations make better decisions by shaping how data is structured, modeled and communicated.
  

  

You will work as a **consultant**, which means working with different companies and contexts over time. Your role spans the full analytics lifecycle: understanding business needs, shaping data and reporting logic, designing semantic models and supporting users in how to work with the insights created. You’ll collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Cloud Engineers and Solution Architects in team-based deliveries.  

  

**Examples of the kinds of projects you might work on**


* Modernising a customer’s reporting environment into **Microsoft Fabric**, including building semantic models and curated data sets
* Designing a data model that reflects how a sales or operations process actually works, so the business can trust and use the insights
* Establishing self-service analytics capabilities where teams can explore data safely and consistently without relying on one “BI person”
* Supporting end users in understanding how to interpret dashboards and metrics, and how to apply them in decision-making

The focus is on **structure,** clarity and adoption. We build solutions that are used, not just delivered. Most importantly, your work will directly influence how organizations turn data into decisions, shaping strategies and outcomes.

**What you’ll grow into**

You’ll work in a team of specialists who care about the craft. Here, you’ll have the chance to deepen your skills in analytics engineering, data modelling and how to design solutions that hold up over time. Learning happens naturally through collaboration, knowledge sharing and real delivery work.


We support growth through certifications, mentorship and opportunities to lead solution design, and there are different directions for you to go into, for example:


* Becoming stronger in solution and data model architecture
* Taking more ownership in guiding clients and shaping delivery
* Developing toward leadership within the competence area

Growth here is supported and shared. You won’t be expected to drive it alone.

**Who we’re looking for**

You enjoy the *technical* side of analytics. You like understanding how data should be structured, how logic should be modelled and how a solution holds together over time. You thrive in dynamic environments and enjoy translating complexity into clarity.
  

  

You collaborate well with others and communicate in a way that makes things easier to understand. You are curious, reflective and comfortable guiding discussions with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. You value shared learning and believe good solutions are shaped together, not alone.
  

  

If you find energy in solving real problems, building things properly and helping others make sense of data, you’ll fit well here.

**What experiences you bring**

You have a **technical educational background** (for example Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering) and experience working in a **modern data environment**. You are comfortable working hands-on with data modelling and logic, and you communicate clearly in English. Swedish is a plus but not a requirement. Other than that, you also have:


* Experience with **Azure**, **Fabric** or a similar modern data stack
* Strong **SQL** skills for modelling and transformation
* Hands-on **Power BI** experience (**data modelling and DAX**)
* Understanding of data modelling patterns (dimensional, lakehouse, medallion)

Familiarity with Git-based collaboration  

* 

We welcome diverse perspectives and believe they make our solutions stronger, but we primarily work with the **Microsoft** Analytics stack and that’s where we’ve built our depth and best practices. If your experience comes from another ecosystem, we’re still open to talking.

**Curious to learn more before applying?** Have a look around our career site to explore our culture, people and way of working. And if you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our Talent Acquisition Manager, Francisca Andersson.

title: Workplace Experience Coordinator
description:
**About us**

  

Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.

**The Role**


We’re looking for a Workplace Experience Coordinator who will keep our Stockholm office running smoothly and help create an inspiring and welcoming environment for everyone at Soundtrack.


You’ll be the go-to person for everything from daily operations to IT coordination, office logistics and event support.

**Responsibilities**

* Organize and coordinate day-to-day office operations and events
* Manage office supplies, equipment, and facilities maintenance
* Handle office contacts such as external service providers and our office provider (Convendum)
* Coordinate access cards, phone subscriptions, laptop/phone orders and inventory
* Provide technical support for employees (Google Meet, network setup, etc.)
* Set up and host large internal meetings
* Support with offsite/conference/event logistics
* Maintain a welcoming and well-stocked office with fruit, snacks and drinks
* Identify opportunities to improve processes and create a great workplace experience

**About You**


You share our belief in the impact of music. You're collaborative and open, and you know how to balance working independently with being a strong team player.


You’re the kind of person who naturally takes initiative, keeps things organized, and enjoys helping others. You have a hands-on approach and aren’t afraid to solve problems.  

  

**Requirements**

* 1 or more years of experience in an office coordinating, operations or administrative role
* Deep interest in & general IT knowledge - bonus if you have experience with any of the following:
	+ Google Workspace/Cloud
	+ Networking (we use Unifi)
	+ Professional audio setups (we use Dante)
	+ Computer/device procurement
* Strong organizational and communication skills
* A proactive and service-minded attitude
* Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus)

**Employee Benefits**

* + A flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely once a week for this position
	+ Generous pension plan
	+ Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
	+ Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
	+ Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
	+ Daily breakfast served at the office


At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.


We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.


If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Elisabeth Ljungqvist at elisabeth@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Location:** Skövde (SE), Stockholm (SE), Oslo (NO) or The Hague (NL) / Hybrid  

**Department:** IT  

**Reports to:** CIO

**Why Join Us?**


Welcome to Aptic, the place where innovative technology meets sustainable software development.


At Aptic, we develop innovative fintech solutions to automate banking, finance, and e-commerce processes. We are a stable solid company that has kept the startup spirit. We’re proud to build robust, user-friendly systems that support our customers in their daily operations—and we want you to help us raise the bar even higher.


**What** You’ll Do


In this role, you will operate, monitor, and maintain Aptic’s infrastructure across physical servers, virtual environments, networking, storage, cloud solutions and operating systems. You'll also troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure issues to ensure high availability and performance as well as assist in implementing security, compliance and backup solutions. The role also includes support of upgrades, migrations and new deployments.

**What** You’ll Bring

* Experience with Microsoft platform:  

(Microsoft on-prem, Windows server, Hyper-V, Active directory, Azure)
* Dell networking, Fortinet, Hyper-V, Veeam, and similar is an advantage.
* Fluent in English (written and verbal).
* Calm and focused under pressure.
* Comfortable working in a distributed team.
* Self-driven and team-oriented.
* EU work permit.
  

**What’s In It** For You?

* 25 paid holidays per year.
* Attractive work-locations and flexible working environment with a combination of work from home and office solutions.
* Wellness budget and pension scheme.
* A culture that values ideas, initiative, and collaboration
* Opportunities to take responsibility and drive change
* Stable working environment with a good work / life balance

**Ready to Apply?**


Sounds like you? Apply in minutes—no cover letter required. We can’t wait to meet you!

**About us**


Aptic AB is a rapidly growing fintech company headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. We are one of the leading and most technically advanced companies within our field in the fintech industry, specialized in developing innovative solutions in the financial services and e-commerce industries.


Our CLVR platform covers credit solutions for BNPL, Ledger service, Factoring, Lending/Deposit, Leasing, and Debt Collection, with customers such as Axactor, Visma, and Lowell. Our company culture is based on a strong commitment to excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction.

title: CloudOps Support Specialist
description:
**The Role**


We’re expanding our CloudOps team to meet growing demand for our AWS managed services. As a CloudOps Support Specialist, you’ll be part of a team of AWS-certified experts responsible for monitoring, managing, and optimizing our clients’ cloud environments. You’ll work directly with businesses who trust us to keep their critical infrastructure running around the clock.

**What You’ll Do**

* **Monitor & Respond:** Provide monitoring and rapid response to incidents, ensuring minimal downtime for client environments
* **Optimize Performance:** Proactively identify and implement performance improvements across AWS infrastructure
* **Disaster Recovery:** Implement and maintain backup and disaster recovery solutions
* **Client Communication:** Serve as a technical point of contact, explaining complex cloud concepts in business-friendly terms
* **Continuous Improvement:** Contribute to automation initiatives and service delivery improvements

**What We’re Looking For**

**Required:**

* AWS certification (Solutions Architect Associate, SysOps Administrator, or equivalent)
* 2+ years of hands-on experience with AWS services (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, CloudWatch, etc.)
* Strong troubleshooting skills
* Experience with infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English (written and verbal)
* Willingness to participate in on-call rotation

**Nice to Have:**

* Additional AWS certifications (Professional level, Security, Advanced Networking)
* Experience with monitoring tools and automation frameworks

 **Why Join Elastic Move?**

* Work with Cutting-Edge Technology: Manage diverse AWS environments and stay at the forefront of cloud innovation
* Professional Growth: Access to AWS training, certification programs, and continuous learning opportunities
* Collaborative Culture: Join a team of passionate cloud experts who support each other
* Meaningful Impact: Your work directly helps clients achieve operational efficiency and business success
* Flexible Working: Balance between remote work and collaboration

 **Our Service Model**


You’ll be supporting our tiered CloudOps service offering, which includes:

* Automated monitoring and alerting
* Proactive security and compliance management
* Cost optimization and FinOps support
* Disaster recovery planning and execution
* Dedicated technical account management for premium clients

title: Service Team Manager
description:
**We are recruiting for a Service Team Manager to join our growing Service team in Stockholm!**


**If you have experience in payroll and managing a team we would love to hear from you!**


**LOCATION: Östermalmstorg 1, 114 42 Stockholm, Sweden**


**Hybrid working – 3 days in office and 2 days from home**


**JOB PURPOSE:**


Effective management of resources and processes to ensure quality, consistency and excellence of service. Building and maintaining effective client relationships to ensure thorough understanding of all clients in the current portfolio, including detailed knowledge of the client's business including their requirements from ADP.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


To ensure delivery of excellent service through:


* World Class Service delivery


* Client retention


* Associate retention, support, development and engagement


**KEY DUTIES/TASKS:**


* Ensure service level agreements between ADP and clients are being met


* Liaise with other departments and MPS teams and managers as necessary to ensure service delivery criteria are met


* Management of client contact including service reviews, calls, meetings and client visits


* Review and analysis Net Promoter Score (NPS) feedback and create management action plans, as appropriate


* Monitor and ensure agreed processes and procedures are carried out in regard to payroll processing


* Ensure all client payroll procedures are current


* Ensure that all MPS client communication (in or out) is dealt with appropriately


* Ensure client queries into MPS are dealt with appropriately, and act as a point of escalation


* Plan and manage the delivery of client payrolls


* Plan and manage delivery of all client "end of year" and P11d requirements


* Manage day-to-day resourcing


* Manage the day-to-day activities of team members to ensure payroll deadlines are met


* Sign off payrolls for live BACS transmission


* Review payroll-delivery team performance and provide monthly reports and analysis


* Evaluate associates' workloads to ensure the efficient distribution of new business within the team


* Ensure that associates are adequately trained and developed


* Ensure that associates are aware of and are applying current Inland Revenue legislation


* Create and execute training plans for new members of staff


* Human Resource (HR) reporting


* Carry out 1:1s and performance reviews in line with ADP policy; create, support and monitor personal development plans (PDPs) for team members


* Maintain knowledge of current ADP products and services


* Carry out other duties as required to fulfil the role, including client visits when necessary


* Follow ADP policy as stated in the Associate Handbook


**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


Reports to the Business Unit Director with responsibility for leading a team of Payroll Specialists to:


* Ensure World Class Service delivery to clients


* Ensure that all payrolls and associated services are delivered accurately and on time


* Review processes and implement process improvement


* Support and develop associates ensuring World Class Service delivery


**SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:**


Knowledge required:


* Payroll Knowledge
* Strong customer service skills


* Process and quality improvement


* Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word and PowerPoint


Skills required - Must be able to demonstrate the following competencies:.


* Innovation and problem solving


* Financial and commercial awareness


* Communication and influencing


* Teamwork and co-operation


* Results orientation


* Flexibility and organisational commitment


* Service Orientation


* Managing Performance


* Developing Others


* Leadership


* Proficient in English and Swedish.


**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**


* Operations management: capacity planning, resource management, skills management, performance measurement and management, quality management and continuous improvement


* Chairing and managing internal and external meetings


* Experience of working with and consistently delivering to client SLAs


* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, at all levels


***BENEFITS:***


* Hybrid, 3-2
* Generous wellness benefits
* 39-hour workweek
* Occupational pension
* Give Back - paid time off to volunteer for a cause of your choice
* 30 days holiday
* Annual bonus scheme

**A little about ADP:** We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.


**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.


**Ethics at ADP:** ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Enterprise Architect (Consumer Product Retail Distribution)
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

**Your role**  

Architects are at the heart of our business – they help our clients make sense of new and existing technologies and help them make informed decisions on how to exploit the current technology landscape to their best advantage. Often working as part of a team, our architects are experts in our world-class architectural approach and industry standards.  

We are looking for a Managing Enterprise Architect to join our Domain Retail/CPRD team, where you will work as a stream lead at CIO/CTO level with some of the leading well-known brands within this industry. A Managing Enterprise Architect design, deliver and manage complete enterprise solutions and lead Capgemini operations relating to market development and/or service delivery excellence.


**In this role you will play a key role in:**  

* Establish technology strategy and roadmap supporting current and future business capabilities
* Work on portfolio or program level addressing architectural concerns cross value streams and contribute to the strategic direction of the enterprise architecture and technology investments to maximize the ROI
* Shape and execute business transformation through technology and advise clients on technology solutions enabling them taking advantage of current and emerging opportunities
* Support our sales organization in shaping and advising on new deals

.**Your profile**  

* 15+ years’ experience from the Consumer Products & Retail industry and knowledge of IT processes in retail (e.g. in the areas of SCM, Logistics, WMS, ERP, CRM, Loyalty, eCommerce)and 10+ years’ experience working as an Enterprise Architect in large scale IT transformation programs.
* Deep knowledge in at least one of the following frameworks and standards - IT4IT, ITIL, ArchiMate and TOGAF and experience in one (or more) of the three major public clouds - Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud or Amazon Web Services.
* You are a strong communicator who understands the importance of fostering relationships with business and IT stakeholders, you are comfortable working in a mixed client and Capgemini agile environment – and have a good level of Swedish both spoken and written.
* Bachelor or academic background preferred (or equivalent experience) - preferably in computer science.
 **What we believe you will enjoy about working here**  

* A vibrant environment where you can grow through continuous learning and professional certifications, collaborate with a global network of experts, and stay at the forefront of the latest technologies.
* An extensive benefits package, including parental benefits, occupational and flex pension, private insurance, preventive healthcare, and more.
* A variety of social and wellness activities, from sports and health programs to cultural events and art initiatives, designed to bring employees together and enrich work life.
 **Application**


The team is called Domains and is team of domain experts specialising in navigating our clients through the complexities and interdependencies that characterise large-scale technology-enabled transformation programmes. It's a team of 3000 consultants in Europe, 300 in the Nordics and 25 in Sweden. Our team of experienced Architects, Business Analysts and transformation managers, support our clients in designing, planning, and conducting digital transformations in their business. We’re striving to understand client’s business, current and future challenges, as well as their IT environment. We then propose, design, plan and help to implement new technological solutions or changes in the current IT landscape to improve or transform relevant business processes. We often define requirements for new IT projects that are later implemented by other Capgemini units or external partners.  

  

For questions, please mail dmn\_se\_recruitment@capgemini.com  

  

As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.  

#LI-RR1

**About Capgemini**  

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.

With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.

As an SAP Consultant, you will be responsible for optimizing end-to-end processes through SAP Ariba, SAP Business Network for Supply Chain, and S/4 HANA, helping us improve efficiency, reduce costs, and deliver superior customer service. If you have a track record of implementing and supporting SAP solutions and are a true Team Player that is passionate about adding value to clients and want to advance your career, this could be the role for you!

* Lead and manage the delivery of comprehensive solutions based on SAP Ariba/SAP Business Network for Supply Chain Collaboration.
* Act as a strategic partner to both Ariba and SAP teams, ensuring seamless integration and collaboration.
* Act as an expert in one or more functional areas, including SAP Business Network for Supply Chain, Ariba Upstream and/or Downstream, and Ariba Supplier Lifecycle Management.

Manage and drive cross-functional teams to successful delivery, ensuring that client requirements are met with efficiency and excellence.

Valid certifications add value.
* You should have a strong track record of leading complex Ariba implementations, with the proven ability to manage multiple components effectively and efficiently.

Experience with S/4HANA implementations and upgrades is essential, along with the ability to engage and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels, serving as a trusted strategic advisor.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.


**YOUR ROLE**  

Due to strong growth and increasing demand from our customers, we are now looking for a skilled Cloud Architect to join our team in Sweden.


You will be part of Capgemini’s Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS) unit, focusing on project and consulting services in the Nordics. Our goal is to offer customers comprehensive cloud solutions with industry-specific expertise, advanced cloud technology, and global resources. We offer a variety of services to our customers, from strategic advice to project implementation.


You will help customers optimize their use of cloud resources as part of a balanced IT delivery portfolio. You will be engaged in various cloud commitments and customer projects covering the entire lifecycle, from proposal/justification to project design and implementation.


As a Cloud Architect, you will:  

* Design and implement scalable, secure, and cost-effective cloud architectures that meet business needs
* Evaluate cloud technologies and services to recommend best practices and solutions to optimize performance, reliability, and scalability
* Design and deploy cloud infrastructure using leading platforms such as AWS, Azure, and/or GCP
* Develop and maintain documentation, diagrams, and guidelines for cloud architecture
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth
* Work closely with customers, partners, and other business units to develop and implement innovative and competitive solutions/projects for new and existing customers by leveraging your previous experience in implementing cloud solutions

  

**YOUR PROFILE**  

* Experience in producing highly available cloud infrastructure solutions for large organizations
* Solid knowledge of the features and capabilities of AWS, Azure, and/or GCP
* Good understanding of cloud-native architectures, microservices, containerization, and serverless computing
* Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation
* Experience in creating greenfield solutions and implementing landing zones according to best practices
* Experience in quickly assessing technical feasibility and developing proposals for migrating workloads to AWS, Azure, and/or GCP
* Knowledge of financial operations (FinOps) practices and tools for optimizing and managing cloud costs
* Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert, or Google Professional Cloud Architect are advantageous
* Understanding of hybrid cloud solutions and experience in integrating public cloud into traditional hosting/delivery models
* Full working proficiency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
**What we believe you will enjoy about working here**

* A vibrant environment where you can grow through continuous learning and professional certifications, collaborate with a global network of experts, and stay at the forefront of the latest technologies
* The freedom to make decisions, manage your time, and work independently - fostering creativity, innovation, and job satisfaction

title: Technical Sales Executive Scandinavia (Norway, Denmark or Sweden)
description:
Join Nordcloud and be part of the European cloud revolution. We supercharge our customers to innovate in hyperscaler cloud, enabling seamless migration, advanced security, and data-driven success. This role focuses on winning new clients in the Enterprise and Corporate business sectors and develop some of our current customers in parallel. As a trusted advisor, you will develop strong relationships with C-level executives and  

stakeholders, ensuring Nordcloud becomes their go-to partner for cloud services.


**Currently, we are looking for a** **Technical Sales Executive – Scandinavia (Norway, Sweden, Denmark)**

  

As a Technical Sales Executive at Nordcloud, you will be a driving force in our sales organisation, identifying client needs, designing cloud solutions, and managing the entire sales process. By delivering innovative cloud solutions, you will help clients increase operational efficiency and reduce costs, and ensuring that technology drives measurable business outcomes.


Your technical acumen and consultative approach will empower you to understand complex client challenges, architect impactful solutions, and communicate the business benefits of cloud adoption to C-level and technical stakeholders.


You will own your results, demonstrate a winner's attitude, and collaborate closely with colleagues across Nordcloud and IBM Consulting to achieve your goals.

  

**Your** **key responsibilities:**

  

* **Lead Technical Sales Engagements:** Identify client needs and design tailored cloud solutions that deliver measurable business outcomes. Drive new business within existing client base as well as within new logo acquisitions leveraging your technical expertise, solution mindset and ability to link desired business value to technical solutions.
* **Collaborate for Success:** Work as part of larger teams—often led by IBM Consulting—integrating Nordcloud's cloud solutions and value proposition into comprehensive, high-impact deals. Build strong relationships with internal teams, partners (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), and stakeholders to deliver best-in-class solutions.
* **Create Business Value:** Apply a solution-based sales approach to address complex customer challenges, always focusing on how technology can advance the client's strategic objectives.
* **Ownership for Results:** Take full responsibility for meeting and exceeding sales targets in consultancy and service sales, with a focus on cloud infrastructure, modernization, managed services, and consulting portfolios.
* **Drive and Winner's Attitude:** Approach every opportunity with energy, resilience, and a relentless drive to win. Celebrate successes and learn from setbacks, always striving for excellence.
* **Solution Workshops & Discovery:** Lead workshops and discovery sessions with client stakeholders to uncover pain points and co-create strategies that maximize the value of cloud adoption.
* **Thought Leadership**: Represent Nordcloud at industry events and in the media, showcasing your expertise and our leadership in cloud technology.

**What we are looking for:**

  

* **Experience**: 7+ years in technical sales, solution sales, IT consulting, or cloud services, with a strong technical foundation and a proven track record of winning and growing new business.
* **Solution Understanding:** Knowledge of public cloud architectures (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), migration strategies, and cloud-native solutions. Ability to map technology capabilities to client business needs.
* **Consultative Approach:** Experience working directly with C-level stakeholders and senior IT executives, translating technical concepts into business value. With solution selling methodology you will craft tailored value propositions for complex cloud projects.
* **Ownership & Drive:** Demonstrated ability to take ownership for results, operate with a winner's attitude, and thrive in high-growth, fast-paced environments.
* **Collaboration:** Proven ability to collaborate across teams and organizations, including cloud partners, to deliver integrated solutions.
* **Communication:** Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
* **Education:** Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent preferred.
* **Languages:** Fluent in English and at least one Scandinavian language.
* **Bonus Points:** Hands-on experience with cloud services offerings, tools, and processes. Certifications in AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud are highly valued.

We encourage you to **apply**, even if you don't meet all of the requirements. We value your growth potential and enthusiasm!


**What we offer:**


* Individual **training budget** and **exam fees** for partner certifications
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working model
* Laptop and equipment to enable your efficient work
* **Local package** such as extensive private health care and insurance, wellness benefits


Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy (https://nordcloud.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/) before applying. **All applicants must have the right to work in Sweden.**


**About Nordcloud**


Nordcloud is a European leader in cloud implementation, application development, managed services and training. It's a recognised cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record helping organisations leverage public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings and sustainable value.
  

  

Nordcloud is triple-certified across Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform – with 10 European hubs, over 1,300 employees and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects for companies ranging from midsize to large corporates.  

  

Our clients benefit from multi-cloud expertise that guides best practices, preempts pitfalls, provides essential technical support and steers teams through cultural change. From strategy planning to application management, we take our customers through the whole cloud journey to drive real business outcomes from cloud technology.  

  

Learn more at www.nordcloud.com (http://www.nordcloud.com)


*Nordcloud values diversity and is dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all candidates and employees.*


#LI-Hybrid #LI-HM1

title: Functional Safety Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

**Your role**  

The role is an integrated part of our System Safety Competence Center (SSCC) where a team of (System Safety Leaders) SSLs are together achieving the long-term goals of ensuring and delivering safe products within the System Safety area. System Safety includes Functional Safety (FUSA) as well as Safety of the Intended Functionality (SOTIF).

*In this role you will play a key role in:*  

* Drive the implementation of ISO 26262 & ISO 21448 and system safety processes across the organization.
* Develop and maintain system safety methods, tools, and best practices.
* Conduct awareness and training sessions to enhance the organization's understanding of system safety, principles, standards and way of working.
* Provide expert support and guidance on system safety processes to various departments, including engineers and managers.
* Perform confirmation reviews of system safety work products to ensure compliance with ISO 26262.
**Your profile**  

* Minimum 4 years of experience in Functional Safety
* Good knowledge of systems engineering including embedded SW/HW in the automotive domain.
* Good knowledge of system safety engineering practices, safety standards and product safety.
* Deep knowledge in the automotive relevant system safety standards e.g. (ISO 26262, ISO 21448)
* Experience in risk assessment and analysis methodologies (HARA, FTA, FMEDA, FMEA) and processes/methods/tools for functional safety and safety of the intended functionality.
**What we believe you will enjoy about working here**  

* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.
**Application**  

As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.

**The Role**  

This Role sits at the heart of the customer business problem in creating and proposing the best of Capgemini as a solution that is a match for the client requirement. You engage with the customer, either proactively or via request, to draw out the business challenges that they have and align the Capgemini solution portfolio to it. Communicating the solution to the client, you demonstrate the value that Capgemini adds and how we are differentiated to meet and exceed their business needs.  

The role needs a techno-functional visionary leader with strategic thinking and a strong knowledge of Cloud and Infrastructure solutions with a particular focus on Public Cloud Hosting, Hyperscaler offers, Move to Cloud, Finops and Hyperscaler Partner Funding Models. Someone with a startup mindset and attitude, who is a great motivator, brings people together and act as the catalyst to achieve the best possible solution. A well informed opinion in the use of Agentic Ai and automation principles as levers of driving down client TCO is essential. Critical to the success of the role is someone who can build trusted relationships with account teams and senior clients to drive business growth.  

  

Responsibilities:

* Actively develop and drive strategic and tactical opportunities within the Nordics
* Provide technical and sector guidance and support throughout the sales process, including responding to inquiries, conducting assessments, and developing proposals
* Work with customers to develop and implement strategic plans to ensure successful adoption of Capgemini Solutions
* Maintain a deep understanding of the Nordics market and stay up to date with the latest developments
* Participate in industry events and conferences to share your knowledge and expertise and network with customers and partners showing thought leadership
* When required, operate as a Solution Lead or Solution Architect to provide essential deal capacity
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders, strategy formation and execution, understanding and navigating across business units and technical practices to shape and coordinate various team inputs for proposals
* Maintain close alignment with the Nordic Cloud COE
* Work across our partner organisations to bring the best of their products/services together with Capgemini services (Amazon, Microsoft, Google). Strong knowledge and experience of Hyperscaler Cloud Native tooling is essential.

**Your Profile**

* Demonstrable experience of navigating a large matrixed Service Provider type organizations including Run (Managed Services) and Projects and Consulting structures
* Strong transformation/change and solutions expertise
* Full working proficiency in English
* Demonstrated ability to develop and deliver compelling technical demonstrations and presentations
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to understand and address complex technical challengeW

title: Data Scientist (Knowledge Graph)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Insights & Data team is at the forefront of this mission, delivering end-to-end Data & AI solutions across industries. With over 550 specialists in the Nordics, we leverage strategic partnerships with Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks, and Snowflake to scale Data & Analytics in the Cloud. Here, your expertise and perspective matter - join us in driving innovation and transforming industries with cutting-edge data solutions!

**Your role**


As a Knowledge graph consultant, you will help our clients make better data-driven decisions by modeling and building robust data flows, creating an efficient data transporter, and building data architecture for Machine Learning solutions and BI solutions. You will also work with the development of computer science solutions stars on graph technology.

*In this role you will play a key role in:*

* Assisting our clients in their work, as they exploit the capabilities of the W3C Semantic Stack (RDF, RDFS, SPARQL, OWL, SHACL), graph databases and ontology modelling tools, or tech stack like **Neo4j**, Cypher or Labeled Property Graph implementations.
* Combining knowledge graphs with Natural Language Processing – a perfect opportunity for someone with a background as linguist combined with a great interest in knowledge graphs.
* Working with a variation of clients located across Northern Europe. In a hybrid working model, you might be asked to travel while on other occasions you will be working remotely.
* Bringing success in the role, by thriving in an international environment, where you generously share your domain knowledge within Graph technology.
**Your profile**

  

* You have worked in the public or private sector, where you have used your domain experience in knowledge graph technologies. You enjoy solving complex modeling problems
* Knowledge about Linked Data Concepts
* ETL processes with various graph databases and experience in Interaction with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages
* Information and Data Management
* Programming skills (specific language is not required, but we use Python, Java or .Net)
* Semantic technologies: Utilize (W3C) Standards of the Semantic Stack. Knowledge regarding several databases (or excellent on at least one) and modelling knowledge with ontologies using various tools.

Skills for LPG: Knowledge regarding several databases or excellent on at least one.  
* 
* *You live in Stockholm Greater area of Sweden.*

**What we believe you will enjoy about working here**

* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We work closely with **Neo4J** on both a local and European level.

Welcome to apply!

title: Cybersecurity Engineer - Automotive
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.


Long Description
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.  

  

**Your Role**  

We are seeking a technically strong and experienced Cybersecurity Engineer to support the design, implementation, and validation of cybersecurity controls across vehicle platforms. This role demands hands-on expertise in automotive cybersecurity standards, regulatory compliance, and risk assessment methodologies, especially TARA (Threat Analysis and Risk Assessment) and HARA (Hazard Analysis and Risk Assessment).  

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*  

  

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Cybersecurity Implementation**: Lead the integration of in-vehicle cybersecurity controls and support TARA/HARA at system and vehicle levels.
* **Regulatory Compliance**: Ensure adherence to global and regional standards, including UNECE R155, ISO/SAE 21434, and Chinese GB/T regulations.
* **Architecture & Collaboration**: Design and review cybersecurity architectures; work closely with system engineering and E/E architecture teams.
* **Development & Lifecycle Support**: Contribute across the vehicle development lifecycle using platforms like Vector AUTOSAR, Linux, QNX, and Android.

 **Must Have**  

Technical knowledge of implementing in-vehicle cybersecurity controls

* **Standards Expertise**: Solid working knowledge of GB/T 44495, GB 44496, GB/T 44464, UNECE R155, and ISO/SAE 21434.
* **Cybersecurity Architecture**: Strong understanding of cybersecurity architectural designs, controls, and system engineering principles.
* **E/E & Functional Architecture**: Deep familiarity with functional and electrical/electronic (E/E) architecture in automotive systems.
* **Hands-on Platform Experience**: Practical experience with Vector AUTOSAR (Cybersecurity), Linux, QNX, and Android environments.
* **Systems Thinking**: Ability to apply system engineering principles across complex vehicle development projects.

  

  

Experience as a technical project manager in at least one full vehicle development cycle at a renowned global OEM  

Expertise in TARA and HARA methodologies for risk and hazard analysis


Long Description**Good to Have**  

Proficiency in project management methodologies: Agile, Scrum, Waterfall  

Ability to identify, assess, and mitigate cybersecurity and project risks  

Strong communication and interpersonal skills for stakeholder coordination

title: Management Consultant
description:
Management Consultant- Graduates/Young Professionals
At Capgemini Invent, we believe difference drives change. As inventive transformation consultants, we blend our strategic, creative and scientific capabilities, collaborating closely with clients to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Join us to drive transformation tailored to our client's challenges of today and tomorrow. Informed and validated by science and data. Superpowered by creativity and design. All underpinned by technology created with purpose.


Your role
Capgemini Invent is seeking inventive and driven graduates and young professionals to join our dynamic team in **Stockholm and Gothenburg.**

*In this role you will play a key role in:*

* Working with leading organisations to solve real business challenges
* Contributing to project that span industries and functions
* Developing strategies, designing new business models, and implementing solutions that drive measurable impact and long-term growth.
Your profile+ **Educational background:** You hold a master’s degree with strong academic results in fields such as Business, Engineering, Data, Computer Science, or Technology. Ideally, you combine this with real-life experience.
+ **Recent graduate:** You are graduating in 2026 or have recently graduated, with 0–1 year of relevant work experience since completing your degree.
+ **Skills and mindset:** You’re curious, analytical, and thrive in fast-paced environments. You enjoy solving complex challenges and are eager to learn and grow—both independently and as part of a team.
+ **Language skills:** You have excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.
+ **Additional merits:** International and professional experiences, as well as involvement in extracurricular activities.

What you'll love about working here+ **Learning & Development:** A key focus of the Accelerate Programme is placed on your development and providing you opportunities to learn a variety of skills in a range of environments. You will benefit from a suite of learning opportunities, including a dedicated WfO Academy curriculum from internal trainings to externally recognized professional accreditations.
+ **Flexibility & Autonomy:** You are free to make your role and your career what you want it to be. Proactivity and ambition flourish at Capgemini Invent. Our hybrid policy enables us to have one of the best scores for work-life balance on Glassdoor – giving you the chance to work from home, in the office, and sometimes abroad.
+ **Global Connection:** Network with our global community through a variety of our award-winning programs, such as InventX and Invent Director Excellence, as well as other various local employee networks to express your uniqueness and find like-minded people

Need to know
Start date and location


As a recent graduate, you’ll join our Stockholm or Gothenburg office in Fall 2026, with readiness to travel and work on projects at our client sites.


Application process


Applications are reviewed continuously—apply early to secure your spot. Submit your **CV in English** and your official **high school** & **university transcripts** (uploaded under “Cover Letter” when you apply through the system). There is only one field available for uploading your grades. Therefore, we kindly ask you to **merge your high school, bachelor's, and master's transcripts** into a single document before uploading.


Clearly state your expected graduation date and preferred office location(s). Incomplete applications will not be considered.


*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required*.




Next steps
  

Our selection process includes several steps to ensure a fair and thorough evaluation:


+ CV & grade screening
+ Phone interview
+ Video interview
+ On-site group case
+ Final interview
+ Offer

title: AWS Architect
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra Cloud & Custom applications-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
  

  

**Om rollen**  

Är du en erfaren Cloud AWS-expert som vill arbeta med de senaste molnteknologierna? Capgemini i Göteborg söker AWS Architects, Specialists, Solution Architects, System Architects, Tech Leads och DevSecOps Developers till vårt växande team. Vi erbjuder spännande projekt med GenAI, moderna frameworks och AWS-teknologier på nordisk nivå. Oavsett om du vill vara hands-on, fatta strategiska beslut eller leda experter – vi har en roll för dig. Hos oss får du en inkluderande arbetsmiljö, trevliga kollegor och stora möjligheter till lärande och karriärutveckling. #GetTheFutureYouWant.  



  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra Cloud & Custom applications-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!  

  

  

  

**Om rollen**  

Vi söker en Cloud Architect som vill ta molnlösningar till nästa nivå med Amazon Web Services (AWS). Hos oss får du arbeta med det senaste inom säkerhet, infrastruktur, DevSecOps, generativ AI och agentisk AI – och vara med och skapa lösningar som påverkar miljoner människor världen över. I rollen blir du en nyckelperson som förvandlar idéer till verklighet. Du kommer att leda strategiska initiativ på nordisk nivå, inspirera kunder och agera som deras trusted advisor, delta i molnkonferenser, bidra i pre-sales och nätverka med våra partners Amazon, Microsoft och Google.  

  

Vi erbjuder karriärmöjligheter i världsklass, projekt inom exempelvis självkörande bilar, livräddande robotar, autonoma system och framtidens AI-lösningar. Du blir en del av ett engagerat team som värdesätter innovation och samarbete – med månatliga aktiviteter och en kultur där vi har kul tillsammans. Vi letar efter fler kollegor som vill hänga med på vår AWS-resa till vårt kontor i Stockholm.
  

  

Vi arbetar med tekniker som AWS Bedrock, Amazon Q, AWS Quick Suite, AWS Lambda, AWS Control Tower och programmeringsspråk som Java, Python, Node, React, Angular, TypeScript, Kafka, Golang, Kotlin, Terraform och Ansible.  

  

  



  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*


* Driva strategi och initiativ inom cloud på nordisk nivå.
* Hjälpa våra kunder med molnarkitektur och cloud native lösningar.

Använda dig utav generativ och agentisk AI.  
*

* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av molntjänster som AWS eller GCP.
* Kunskap i ett eller flera programmeringsspråk, t.ex. Python, Java, Kotlin, Golang eller Node.
* Erfarenhet som molnarkitekt eller av att leda molntransformationer.
* Intresse för DevSecOps, generativ AI, agentisk AI och cloud-native lösningar.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i AWS services.
* Flytande svenska och engelska kunskaper, i både tal och skrift.
 **Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**

* Arbeta med de senaste teknologierna och påverka på nordisk nivå. Du samarbetar med andra specialister, kompetensväxlar och bidrar till att bygga AWS-kapabilitet i Norden – samtidigt som du påverkar några av världens största bolag.
* Utvecklas genom utbildningar, certifieringar och interna initiativ- Du får tillgång till utbildningar och certifieringar inom AI och AWS samt möjlighet att engagera dig i Capgeminis fokusområden som Diversity & Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness Club och Art Club.
* Njut av en engagerande arbetsplats med starkt stöd och förmåner. Vi erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension, bonusprogram, företagshälsovård och sjukvårdsförsäkring – samt en inkluderande kontorskultur med sociala aktiviteter och teambuilding.

Under processen får du chansen att kika in på vårt kontor, prata med vår rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Varmt välkommen in med din ansökan!*  

  

*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*  

  

Till denna roll söker vi medarbetare för säkerhetsklassat uppdrag placerad hos kund.
  

  

Hos våra kunder arbetar vi i leveranser som kan ha bland annat #AWS, #GCP, #Google, Azure, AliCloud, Java, Go/Golang, Python, Kotlin, Node, HTML, TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, Java, CloudFormation, Terraform, Docker, Kafka, React, Angular, Vue, Bash, Spring, GenAI, GraphQL, Backstage, Kubernetes, LLM, RAG, Copilot, GitHub Actions, SonarQube, BlackDuck, Apache Beam, Kong, Jenkins, Apigee, OpenShift, Ansible, DevSecOps, cloud architecture, cloud assessments, integration, Snowflake, Elastic Search, Grafana, Kibana, Splunk, Databricks, HelmChart, CloudFoundry.'

title: Application Consultant Dynamics 365 F&O (Finance)
description:
At PBS Nordics, a Capgemini business unit, we empower individuals to shape their careers within a collaborative global community.
  

  

Specializing in ERP transformation services for both public and private sectors, PBS Nordics delivers tailored solutions using top ERP systems like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.
  

  

**Your role**  

As Application Consultant you together with your team and the client, you work to create efficient business processes and adding value for the customer using Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations as the platform. You become part of an experienced team with application consultants, developers, architects, and project managers, ranging from junior to senior levels.
  

  

*In this position you will play a key role in:*

* Implementation projects working as finance stream lead consultant in Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations platform
* Lead the design in the finance stream, configuration, and implement the Dynamics platform, ensuring it aligns with business requirements with the latest technology with Power Platform/ PowerApps/Power Automate
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and the client
* Stay updated with the latest technology and industry trends

  

**Your profile**  

* Project experience from D365 F&O projects and deep business knowledge in the finance processes in Dynamics F&O platform or several years of experience as super user in the platform
* Consultant experience
* Drive to develop and embrace new technology and bridging IT and business together
* Strong analytic skills and a problem-solving mindset

  

*Note: You need to be based in Sweden and proficiency in Swedish to be considered for the role.***What we believe you will enjoy about working here**  

* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness and with a strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.

  

**Application**  

*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, as well as background checks which is a condition to undertake this role.*  

  

**About Capgemini**  

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
  

  

**Get The Future You Want** | www.capgemini.com

You become part of an experienced team with application consultants, developers, architects, and project managers, ranging from junior to senior levels.
  

  

*In this position you will play a key role in:*  



* Implementation projects working as supply chain stream lead consultant in Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations platform
* Lead the design in the supply chain stream, configuration, and implement the Dynamics platform, ensuring it aligns with business requirements with the latest technology with Power Platform/ PowerApps/Power Automate
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and the client
* Stay updated with the latest technology and industry trends

  

**Your profile**  

* Project experience from D365 F&O projects and deep business knowledge in one or more of the supply chain areas e.g. production, warehouse management, asset management or procurement in Dynamics F&O platform or several years of experience as super user in the platform in SCM modules
* Consultant experience
* Drive to develop and embrace new technology and bridging IT and business together
* Strong analytic skills and a problem-solving mindset

  

*Note: You need to be based in Sweden and proficiency in Swedish to be considered for the role.***What we believe you will enjoy about working here**  

* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness and with a strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person.

  

**Application**  

*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification will be conducted through inspection of your ID card, and background checks may be carried out as required.*  

  

**About Capgemini**  

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
  

  

**Get The Future You Want** | www.capgemini.com
