 **databaser**
 ✔️ Goda kunskaper i
 **Git** 
 och versionshantering
   

  

 ✔️ Erfarenhet av
 **agila metoder**
 Ett extra plus om du har någon av dessa kompetenser
   

  

 ✔️ Vana att arbeta med
 **Docker** 
 ,
 **Kubernetes** 
 ,
 **Jenkins** 
 och
 **CI/CD-pipelines**
 ✔️ Erfarenhet av molnplattformar såsom
 **AWS** 
 ,
 **Azure** 
 eller
 **Google Cloud**
 ✔️ Erfarenhet av
 **mikrotjänst-arkitektur** 
 (microservices)
   

  

 ✔️ Kännedom om
 **Kafka** 
 eller andra meddelandeköer
   

  

 ✔️ Intresse för
 **finansiella system** 
 eller förståelse för finansbranschen
   

  

 ✔️ Tidigare erfarenhet som
 **konsult eller underkonsult**
**Vi erbjuder**
**En prisbelönt arbetsplats** 
 – vi har utsetts till "Årets Karriärföretag" och rankats som en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser.
   

  

 Branschledande
 **kunder inom bank, finans och försäkring** 
 . Vi vet att utveckling skapas genom att lösa utmanande uppgifter i spännande uppdrag med stöd av erfarna kollegor.
   

  

 En snabbväxande, platt organisation med en dynamisk och utvecklande miljö. Våra konsulter drivs av att
 **tillhöra ett sammanhang** 
 och
 **bidra till sin egen och företagets utveckling** 
 . Vi uppmuntrar det ständiga lärandet och investerar i utbildning och certifieringar.
   

  

 En unik
 **wellness-satsning genom** 
**Team B3** 
 . Vi tror på frihet under ansvar och balans i livet, då vi vet att medarbetare som mår bra också presterar bättre.
   

  

**Ansök idag!**
 Låter detta som något för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

**Kontakt:** 
 Konsultchef Ann-Charlotte Olsson
   

  

 Läs mer om oss på
 **B3 Financial Consulting** 
 och följ med på vår resa!

title: Senior Resident Consultant
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
**HPE - Juniper Networks Advanced Services, EMEA**
 Reporting to the Advanced Services Delivery Manager or Team Leader, this is a highly technical role, providing operational & testing support for Junipers Network Products to a large Service Provider in the Nordics. The Engineer will be required to develop and maintain an expertise on the products deployed within the Customer’s network. This is a full-time position, working as part of a wider Juniper Advanced Services team. Location is flexible, but regular visits to customer sites in Nordic countries (Norway, Sweden, Denmark and Finland) will be required.
   

  

 Typical activities of the RC are around the following key areas;
   

  

* Providing day to day operational support, troubleshooting network issues
* Fault finding and taking corrective actions, working closely with Juniper Support and Engineering teams
* Network device configuration review and optimisation
* Config/design validation and verification testing
* Interoperability testing
* Software Versioning (‘bug scrub’)
* Implementation support
* Knowledge Transfer to customer staff


**Responsibilities**
 Remote and On-site technical support to the Customer may also require the RC:
   

  

* To participate in design and information gathering workshops to understand the customers existing network design and technical requirements
* To understand the customers organizational structure and become familiar with the customers network implementation and support processes and procedures;
* To carry out testing of new features and functionality required by the customer in a laboratory environment and to implement and verify that they are operating correctly in the live network;
* To test new releases and fixes to operating software and to ensure that they are implemented and functioning correctly in the live network;
* To troubleshoot equipment and network problems and to open and track Juniper TAC cases through to problem resolution;
* To produce a written summary report of the status of equipment and network problems on a regular basis to the customer;
* To hold technology workshops with the customer to discuss equipment and network problems, and to provide case status updates, including the reasons for any problems encountered and the workarounds and/or solutions that are being tried;
* To train the customers design, implementation and support personnel to configure and operate Juniper Networks products;
* To assist the customer to develop Network Operating and Equipment Operating Procedures. The RC may also be expected to develop secondary skills in other products in the Juniper product portfolio.


**Requirements**
 The ideal candidate for this role must be able to demonstrate the following credentials:
   

  

 Detailed technical experience in the testing, installation and operation of IP routers in a Service provider environment. This includes hands-on operation of management tools and network analyzers. In-depth knowledge of, and experience with active network components and the protocols surrounding IP Service Provider networks is required (CCIE, JNCIP/JNCIE level). A minimum of 10 years experience in networking, with at least 5 years of working in a Service Provider network environment. Candidates will be required to go through a Security Clearance process.
   

  

**These Skills Should Include**
* IPv4 and IPv6, IP subnetting and supernetting and hierarchical routing principles.
* Routing protocol operation (OSPF, IS-IS, BGP)
* BNG / subscriber management
* L2 and L3 VPNs and the associated technologies (L2TP, MPLS, etc.)
* QoS/CoS, Multicast, PTP
* Understanding of network/router security and common practices.
* Detailed understanding of Layer 2 protocols and technologies
* Experience with working with Juniper Networks equipment and JUNOS, in particular MX- and PTX-series routers
* Strong troubleshooting skills are a requirement.
* Strong Interpersonal skills. Ability to work as part of a team, with multiple departments within Juniper and with the host company in a responsible and professional fashion.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and work under pressure.
* Self starter, team player, personable, enthusiastic, hard working, and enjoy interfacing with customers on a day to day basis.
* Hands-on configuration experience, and operational knowledge of Juniper Networks Products is a must.


 Specifics for this position: Juniper MX-series experience and familiarity with Data Centre technologies is a huge plus. Knowledge of Network Implementation best practices. Strong organisational and time-management skills. Must be fluent in English and possess good written and verbal communication skills. This role involves international travel (e.g. customer site visits, training, internal events).
   

  

**Additional Skills**
 Cloud Architectures, Cross Domain Knowledge, Design Thinking, Development Fundamentals, DevOps, Distributed Computing, Microservices Fluency, Full Stack Development, Security-First Mindset, User Experience (UX)
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Unconditional Inclusion**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #norway
   

  

 #networking
   

  

**Job**
 Engineering
   

  

**Job Level**
 TCP\_04
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or any other protected category, and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Seniora hållfasthetsingenjörer sökes till Advanced Platform
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll* 
*.*
 Din roll
   

  

 På Advanced Platforms söker vi drivna hållfasthetsingenjörer som vill vara med och forma skroven till framtidens stridsflygplan. Vi är i en intensiv och växande fas och du ska vara redo att utmana arbetssätt och metoder tillsammans med oss för att få fram nya tekniska lösningar och bygga experimentflygplan. På området tittar vi på framtidens autonoma flygkoncept med överljudskapacitet där arbetet består av teknikstudier, mark-demonstratorer och flygande demonstratorer. Ambitionen är att vara en organisation som är snabbfotad och utför teknologiutveckling i snabba loopar med ett stort lärande.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Vi söker efter dig, hållfasthetsingenjör med några eller flera års erfarenhet, som vill vara en del av vår organisation där vi vågar prova nytt, vågar utmana men också vågar att misslyckas. Att vara redo att anamma lärdomarna och fortsätta framåt. Du ska vara en lagbyggare och ha en god förståelse för den verksamhet du ska arbeta i. Det är viktigt att ha en bra förståelse för hur en struktur fungerar i dess helhet och är du en fena på handberäkningar så är detta platsen för dig!
   

  

*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
 Tjänsten kan baseras och utföras både från vårt kontor i Stockholm och i Linköping.
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.

title: Revenue Cloud Account Executive
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.
   

  

 Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.
   

  

**Cloud Account Executive – Revenue Cloud | Sweden**
**Powering the Future of Revenue Operations**
 Revenue management is more complex than ever, with businesses navigating
 **subscription models, usage-based pricing, and intricate deal structures** 
 .
 **Salesforce Revenue Cloud** 
 is the industry-leading solution that helps companies unify their revenue processes—
 **from Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) to Billing, Revenue Recognition, and Subscription Management** 
 —all on the world’s #1 CRM.
   

  

 As businesses embrace digital-first sales strategies, Revenue Cloud enables them to
 **close deals faster, automate revenue workflows, and gain real-time visibility into their financials** 
 . By eliminating manual inefficiencies and driving data-driven decision-making, Revenue Cloud empowers organisations to scale and optimize their revenue streams with
 **speed, accuracy, and compliance** 
 .
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced
 **Account Executive** 
 to help drive adoption of Revenue Cloud across Sweden, working with some of the most ambitious companies in the market. This is an opportunity to work at the forefront of digital transformation and revenue optimisation, partnering with
 **C-suite leaders** 
 to solve their most critical challenges.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own the full sales cycle—prospecting, strategy, and closing
* Act as a trusted advisor, guiding customers through complex revenue operations transformations.
* Engage C-level executives in meaningful conversations about modernizing revenue management with automation and AI.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to showcase the power of Revenue Cloud and the wider Salesforce ecosystem.
* Exceed sales targets while building lasting relationships that drive customer success.


**What We’re Looking For**
* SaaS Sales Expertise – A proven track record in CPQ, billing, or revenue operations solutions.
* Enterprise Sales Experience – Skilled in managing complex deals with multiple stakeholders.
* Strategic Thinking – Ability to drive high-impact discussions on revenue transformation and digital sales.
* Excellent Communication – Strong storytelling, negotiation, and closing skills.
* Industry Knowledge – Understanding of subscription models, B2B sales cycles, and revenue management trends.
* Bonus: Experience with Salesforce ecosystem solutions like Data Cloud or Marketing Cloud.


**Why Join Salesforce**
* Innovative Culture: Be part of a company that's reshaping the future with advanced AI models and cloud solutions
* Global Impact: Contribute to products that are transforming industries worldwide
* Career Growth: Access to professional development opportunities, mentorship programs, and a clear path for advancement
* Benefits & Perks: Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including competitive compensation, health benefits, education reimbursements, family-first policies, wellness programs, and more


 Unleash Your Potential
   

  

 When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and
 *be your best* 
 , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can
 *do your best* 
 . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Service Team Manager
description:
**We are recruiting for a Service Team Manager to join our growing Service team in Stockholm!**
**If you have experience in payroll and managing a team we would love to hear from you!**
**LOCATION: Östermalmstorg 1, 114 42 Stockholm, Sweden**
**Hybrid working – 3 days in office and 2 days from home**
**Job Purpose**
 Effective management of resources and processes to ensure quality, consistency and excellence of service. Building and maintaining effective client relationships to ensure thorough understanding of all clients in the current portfolio, including detailed knowledge of the client's business including their requirements from ADP.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 To ensure delivery of excellent service through:
   

  

* World Class Service delivery
* Client retention
* Associate retention, support, development and engagement


**Key Duties/Tasks**
* Ensure service level agreements between ADP and clients are being met
* Liaise with other departments and MPS teams and managers as necessary to ensure service delivery criteria are met
* Management of client contact including service reviews, calls, meetings and client visits
* Review and analysis Net Promoter Score (NPS) feedback and create management action plans, as appropriate
* Monitor and ensure agreed processes and procedures are carried out in regard to payroll processing
* Ensure all client payroll procedures are current
* Ensure that all MPS client communication (in or out) is dealt with appropriately
* Ensure client queries into MPS are dealt with appropriately, and act as a point of escalation
* Plan and manage the delivery of client payrolls
* Plan and manage delivery of all client "end of year" and P11d requirements
* Manage day-to-day resourcing
* Manage the day-to-day activities of team members to ensure payroll deadlines are met
* Sign off payrolls for live BACS transmission
* Review payroll-delivery team performance and provide monthly reports and analysis
* Evaluate associates' workloads to ensure the efficient distribution of new business within the team
* Ensure that associates are adequately trained and developed
* Ensure that associates are aware of and are applying current Inland Revenue legislation
* Create and execute training plans for new members of staff
* Human Resource (HR) reporting
* Carry out 1:1s and performance reviews in line with ADP policy; create, support and monitor personal development plans (PDPs) for team members
* Maintain knowledge of current ADP products and services
* Carry out other duties as required to fulfil the role, including client visits when necessary
* Follow ADP policy as stated in the Associate Handbook


**Supervisory Responsibilities**
 Reports to the Business Unit Director with responsibility for leading a team of Payroll Specialists to:
   

  

* Ensure World Class Service delivery to clients
* Ensure that all payrolls and associated services are delivered accurately and on time
* Review processes and implement process improvement
* Support and develop associates ensuring World Class Service delivery


**Skills And Knowledge**
 Knowledge required:
   

  

* Payroll Knowledge
* Strong customer service skills
* Process and quality improvement
* Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word and PowerPoint


 Skills required - Must be able to demonstrate the following competencies:.
   

  

* Innovation and problem solving
* Financial and commercial awareness
* Communication and influencing
* Teamwork and co-operation
* Results orientation
* Flexibility and organisational commitment
* Service Orientation
* Managing Performance
* Developing Others
* Leadership
* Proficient in English and Swedish.


**Education And Experience**
* Operations management: capacity planning, resource management, skills management, performance measurement and management, quality management and continuous improvement
* Chairing and managing internal and external meetings
* Experience of working with and consistently delivering to client SLAs
* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, at all levels


**Benefits**
* Hybrid, 3-2
* Generous wellness benefits
* 39-hour workweek
* Occupational pension
* Give Back - paid time off to volunteer for a cause of your choice
* 30 days holiday
* Annual bonus scheme


**A little about ADP:** 
 We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** 
 ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.
   

  

**Ethics at ADP:** 
 ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Software Engineer - AI Developer Workflows
description:
**Frostbite** 
 is EA's proprietary game engine. Its versatile technology power creation on some of the world's most iconic and visually stunning games, including titles from EA Sports and Battlefield. Frostbite provides a unified platform that empowers developers to create hyper-realistic worlds, intricate gameplay, and lifelike animations with unmatched speed and quality.
 



  





**This is a hybrid role. You must be living within commutable distance to our Stockholm office where you will work 3 days per week.** 




  





**The Role** 




 As
 **Software Engineer** 
 at Frostbite, reporting to a Manager of Engine Development, you will contribute to Frostbite's goals of transforming software engineering and quality processes with the power of generative AI, agents and context engineering. You will collaborate with other engineers and technical leaders, and you will roll out solutions to hundreds of engine and game developers, resulting in better games.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* You will develop AI-based foundations and services that allow the Frostbite community to benefit from agentic developer workflows.
* You will provide secure and scalable solutions for all stages of the software development lifecycle, including spec-driven coding, validation and releasing.
* You will pilot new AI capabilities to assess their impact on developer efficiency and quality.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 4+ years of job experience in a hands-on coding role using languages like Python, C# or C++.
* 1+ years of experience using generative AI software engineering solutions such as GitHub CoPilot.
* Proficiency in good development practices (version control, code reviews) and validation (static code analysis, unit testing, CI/CD pipelines).



  





**Bonus but not mandatory** 



* Experience with ML, GenAI and LLM concepts and technologies like knowledge graphs, vector databases, context engineering, MCP, LangChain, or RAG.
* Experience with observability of large data-driven services.
* Experience cloud infrastructure providers like Azure.
* Familiarity with game development processes.



 This is a hybrid role. #LI-Hybrid

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**WHO WE ARE** 





 At Trustly, we're building a smarter, faster, and more secure financial future by revolutionizing the world of payments. As a global leader in Open Banking Payments, we are establishing Pay by Bank as the new standard at checkout, providing unparalleled freedom, speed, and ease to millions of consumers and merchants worldwide.
 




  






 Our Ambition: To build the world’s most disruptive payment network and redefine what the payment experience should feel like.
 




  






 Trustly is a global team of innovators, collaborators, and doers.  If you are driven by a strong sense of purpose and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and high-growth environment, join us and be part of a team that’s transforming the way the world pays.
 




  





**About the Team
 

 Our Product & Technology organisation drives the development of Trustly’s products. The teams collectively work with innovative ideas, development of products and platform and set the vision and strategy. The Product & Tech department consists of about 180 people.
 




  





**About the role
 

 To further strengthen the team responsible for our core backend services, we are now looking to hire additional Software Engineers experienced in Java / Golang.
 





  




**What you’ll do** 
* In your role as Senior Software Engineer, you will play a key role in developing, maintaining and improving our core backend services
* Be a part of our development team and build new product features, as well as our next-generation platform
* Participating in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives to ensure alignment and efficiency in delivery
* Perform code reviews, writing unit tests, and ensuring code quality and best practices
* Drive/Contribute to architectural decisions and technical discussions
* Share your knowledge and experiences to foster a culture of learning and growth within the team



  




**Who you are** 
* 5+ years of experience working with Golang/Java and building robust and scalable systems in agile environments
* Experienced working with cloud based solutions (preferably AWS)
* Experienced with high-availability, high-transactions systems in production
* Passionate about working in a DevOps environment, taking full ownership of service from requirement to production performance






  




  


**Our Fantastic Benefits**

 (varies by location)
 




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 



  





**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.** 



  


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.****

title: Application Engineer (Full-Stack Developer)
description:
**Do you want to contribute to a fossil-free future while developing high-quality software?**
 Do you enjoy working in an international environment and collaborating across teams? Are you passionate about software craftsmanship, innovation, and continuous learning? Then this is the job for you!
   

  

 The
 **Distribution & R&D Software Team** 
 , part of
 **Vattenfall IT** 
 , develops and operates innovative software solutions that directly support our business units in Distribution and Research & Development.
   

  

 Our applications enable smarter grid operations, optimize asset performance, and support the transition towards a fossil-free energy system.
   

  

**What will you do?**
**Your Tasks And Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain web and hybrid mobile applications using JavaScript.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to continuous improvement of development processes.
* Ensuring product stability & security.
* Stay up to date with emerging technologies, innovations, and AI trends.
* Share knowledge and mentor team members to foster a culture of learning and growth.
* Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders across departments.


**Location**
 Solna
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Who are you?**
**As Our Full-Stack Developer You Bring**
* Proven experience as a Full-stack Developer with strong JavaScript skills (minimum 3+ years of experience in TypeScript)
* Hands-on experience in both web and mobile (hybrid) application development.
* Familiarity with frameworks such as Angular or React
* Solid experience in NodeJs (min. 2 years in Express.js or similar)
* Experience in creating APIs in NodeJS
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Eagerness to learn, grow, and share knowledge with others.
* Interest in new technologies, innovations and AI-driven solutions
* Open to work with on-prem solutions
* Nice to have: experience with Microsoft Azure services (e.g., App Services, Functions, DevOps)


 Additional Information
   

  

**Our Offer**
 Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**We welcome your application in English** 
 . We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter
 **Marius Gläßge via marius.glaessge@vattenfall.de**
*Trade union representatives in Sweden (IT)* 
*are Sofi Wadström (Akademikerna), Patricia Ek (Unionen), Christer Gustafsson (Ledarna), Juha Siipilehto (SEKO). To get in contact with the representatives, please call Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.*
 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.
 **Vattenfall IT** 
 is the internal IT provider for the entire Vattenfall Group. It is an international shared service center, providing efficient and reliable IT services and 1.300 IT Engineers located in different European countries provide daily support to the Vattenfall Group.

title: Business Analyst, Data Stewardship
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for an Informatica Data Management Cloud Administrator to join our team in Sweden.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Cognizant collaborates with all major hyperscale’s and relevant software vendors in the data and AI space. This includes partnerships with industry leaders such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Snowflake, and Databricks. Our comprehensive approach ensures that we leverage the best tools and technologies to deliver scalable, secure, and efficient solutions. Additionally, we are supported locally by our dedicated Centres of Excellence, which operate both nearshore and offshore. These centres provide specialized expertise and resources, ensuring that we can meet the unique needs of our clients and drive innovation in AI and data cost effectively.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Business Analyst in the Savings and Investment area is responsible for analyzing business requirements, defining reporting and analytical needs, and specifying data requirements to support data sourcing and integration. Key tasks include collaborating with the business team, drafting specifications, conducting gap and incident analyses, managing data quality, and tracking & building data lineage. The role demands strong knowledge of savings and investment processes, data flows, and project management. The analyst will work within a three-member task force focused on bridging data gaps between business, platform, and data teams to ensure seamless communication and integration.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Involve collaborating closely with the business team to define precise data requirements for submission to the platform development team. The assignment encompasses a broad range of activities including documentation review, detailed analysis, specification drafting, effective communication, development coordination, gap analysis, as well as data mapping and lineage tracking.
* The specialist will also conduct thorough investigations into data point discrepancies, manage data quality assurance processes, perform incident analyses, and coordinate ongoing development efforts.


**Required Skills**
 Knowledge around Savings & Investments area, data flows, data lineage and information management, requirement analysis and documentation, strong project management skills.
   

  

**Nice To Have-skills**
 Handson SQL, MDM Tool, ETL Testing, data quality processes, Data governance lifecycle.

title: Project Manager – EMEA Events & Logistics (Software Sales)
description:
**Introduction**
 We’re looking for an experienced Project Manager to support the EMEA HashiCorp business through the integration into IBM. This role will drive end-to-end project management, support regional execution plans, and manage logistics for strategic events. The ideal candidate is highly organized, thrives in fast-paced environments, and has a strong track record of managing complex event programs across multiple countries. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with sales, marketing, customer success, and external partners to ensure exceptional event experiences that deliver measurable business impact.
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
* Support EMEA event planning & execution – including third-party tradeshows,proprietary field events, executive dinners, roundtables, and roadshows.
* Own project timelines, milestones, and deliverables – ensuring all events are executed on time.
* Collaborate closely with regional sales leaders to align event strategy with go-to-market objectives, account priorities, and pipeline acceleration goals.
* Project manage integration activities to support the EMEA leadership team through the growth objectives into 2026 and beyond.
* Ad hoc activities to support the EMEA LT including planning, logistics and other ad hoc activities as required.


**Preferred Education**
 Bachelor's Degree
   

  

**Required Technical And Professional Expertise**
* 4+ years of project or event management experience in B2B tech, SaaS, or software sales environments.
* Proven success delivering high-quality events across multiple EMEA markets.
* Strong understanding of sales objectives and the role of events in pipeline generation.
* Exceptional organizational skills with a meticulous attention to detail.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Comfortable working independently and cross-functionally in a fast-moving global organization.


**Preferred Technical And Professional Experience**
 Familiarity with IBM and HashiCorp Products and Services.

title: Core System Developer
description:
Trygg-Hansa Affinity is a division of the leading insurance group in the Nordics - Tryg. Affinity focus on add-on insurances to our partners’ core products e.g. Consumer Devices, Cancellation, ID Protection and other insurance categories with distribution partners across Northern Europe.
   

  

**The position**
 Affinity is transitioning its core system to Guidewire Cloud Insurance Suite and is seeking 2 software developers to join this transformation. As a core system developer, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain our core system. You will be part of an agile team of Software Developers and System Business Developers.
   

  

 In this position you will:
   

  

* customize and configure Guidewire Insurance Suite to meet business requirements, such as integrating with ecosystem legacy systems and ensuring data consistency.
* troubleshoot, debug, and resolve technical issues and challenges.
* participate in the full software development life cycle, from planning and design to development, testing, and deployment.
* stay up to date with industry best practices and trends related to Guidewire development, and apply this knowledge to overcome challenges such as implementing new features and maintaining system security and compliance.


 The role is placed in our modern and centrally located Stockholm office and permanent work permit in Sweden is required. We offer you a position in a well-functioning and international team of highly skilled and committed IT experts and we hope to find an equally engaged addition to the team with one of the highest job satisfaction.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To thrive in this role, we are looking for a motivated and curious IT professional who is keen to learn and willing to contribute to a commercially oriented IT team. The ideal candidate will have experience from the Insurance sector and Guidewire development, but it is not a requirement. You should possess proficient analytical and problem-solving skills and be capable of managing tasks on your own and collaboratively within a team.
   

  

 For this role, we envision that you possess:
   

  

* bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
* strong programming skills in Java or Gosu
* experience in Integrating applications by using REST API/WebServices (SOAP)
* experience in version control tool like GIT and BitBucket
* interest for Guidewire cloud solutions
* ability to think critically and a motivation to develop new skills


**Application**
 Welcome to apply via the link. As the recruitment is ongoing, please send your application as soon as possible but no later than 2025-12-01. For questions about the position, please contact recruiting manager Jasmina Suojoki Olsson on +46 70- 870 51 35 or via email jasmina.suojoki@trygghansa.se. Final candidates will undergo a background check as part of the recruitment process.
   

  

 We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

 We kindly decline any contact from advertisement, consultant and recruitment companies.
   

  

**Union representatives**
 Forena: Elias Bakk, elias.bakk@trygghansa.se
   

  

 Akademikerföreningen: Lena Darin, lena.darin@trygghansa.se

title: Technical Sales Executive Scandinavia (Norway, Denmark or Sweden)
description:
Join Nordcloud and be part of the European cloud revolution. We supercharge our customers to innovate in hyperscaler cloud, enabling seamless migration, advanced security, and data-driven success. This role focuses on winning new clients in the Enterprise and Corporate business sectors and develop some of our current customers in parallel. As a trusted advisor, you will develop strong relationships with C-level executives and
   

  

 stakeholders, ensuring Nordcloud becomes their go-to partner for cloud services.
   

  

**Currently, we are looking for a** 
**Technical Sales Executive – Scandinavia (Norway, Sweden, Denmark)**
 As a Technical Sales Executive at Nordcloud, you will be a driving force in our sales organisation, identifying client needs, designing cloud solutions, and managing the entire sales process. By delivering innovative cloud solutions, you will help clients increase operational efficiency and reduce costs, and ensuring that technology drives measurable business outcomes.
   

  

 Your technical acumen and consultative approach will empower you to understand complex client challenges, architect impactful solutions, and communicate the business benefits of cloud adoption to C-level and technical stakeholders.
   

  

 You will own your results, demonstrate a winner’s attitude, and collaborate closely with colleagues across Nordcloud and IBM Consulting to achieve your goals.
   

  

**Your** 
**key responsibilities:**
* Lead Technical Sales Engagements: Identify client needs and design tailored cloud solutions that deliver measurable business outcomes. Drive new business within existing client base as well as within new logo acquisitions leveraging your technical expertise, solution mindset and ability to link desired business value to technical solutions.
* Collaborate for Success: Work as part of larger teams—often led by IBM Consulting—integrating Nordcloud’s cloud solutions and value proposition into comprehensive, high-impact deals. Build strong relationships with internal teams, partners (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), and stakeholders to deliver best-in-class solutions.
* Create Business Value: Apply a solution-based sales approach to address complex customer challenges, always focusing on how technology can advance the client’s strategic objectives.
* Ownership for Results: Take full responsibility for meeting and exceeding sales targets in consultancy and service sales, with a focus on cloud infrastructure, modernization, managed services, and consulting portfolios.
* Drive and Winner’s Attitude: Approach every opportunity with energy, resilience, and a relentless drive to win. Celebrate successes and learn from setbacks, always striving for excellence.
* Solution Workshops & Discovery: Lead workshops and discovery sessions with client stakeholders to uncover pain points and co-create strategies that maximize the value of cloud adoption.
* Thought Leadership: Represent Nordcloud at industry events and in the media, showcasing your expertise and our leadership in cloud technology.


**What we are looking for:**
* Experience: 7+ years in technical sales, solution sales, IT consulting, or cloud services, with a strong technical foundation and a proven track record of winning and growing new business.
* Solution Understanding: Knowledge of public cloud architectures (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), migration strategies, and cloud-native solutions. Ability to map technology capabilities to client business needs.
* Consultative Approach: Experience working directly with C-level stakeholders and senior IT executives, translating technical concepts into business value. With solution selling methodology you will craft tailored value propositions for complex cloud projects.
* Ownership & Drive: Demonstrated ability to take ownership for results, operate with a winner’s attitude, and thrive in high-growth, fast-paced environments.
* Collaboration: Proven ability to collaborate across teams and organizations, including cloud partners, to deliver integrated solutions.
* Communication: Excellent communication, presentation, and organizational skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent preferred.
* Languages: Fluent in English and at least one Scandinavian language.
* Bonus Points: Hands-on experience with cloud services offerings, tools, and processes. Certifications in AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud are highly valued.


 We encourage you to
 **apply** 
 , even if you don’t meet all of the requirements. We value your growth potential and enthusiasm!
   

  

**What we offer:**
* Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working model
* Laptop and equipment to enable your efficient work
* Local package such as extensive private health care and insurance, wellness benefits


 Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying.
 **All applicants must have the right to work in Sweden.**
**About Nordcloud**
 Nordcloud is a European leader in cloud implementation, application development, managed services and training. It’s a recognised cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record helping organisations leverage public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings and sustainable value.
   

  

 Nordcloud is triple-certified across Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform – with 10 European hubs, over 1,300 employees and has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects for companies ranging from midsize to large corporates.
   

  

 Our clients benefit from multi-cloud expertise that guides best practices, preempts pitfalls, provides essential technical support and steers teams through cultural change. From strategy planning to application management, we take our customers through the whole cloud journey to drive real business outcomes from cloud technology.
   

  

 Learn more at www.nordcloud.com
   

  

*Nordcloud values diversity and is dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all candidates and employees.*

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
**Would you like to make a difference by using your technical skills to create innovative payment solutions?**
 TF Avarda Group is a leading provider of white-label payment and financing solutions for businesses across various industries. Focusing on simplifying the payment process and enhancing customer experiences, TF Avarda Group enables 250 companies to thrive in the rapidly changing digital landscape with its advanced, true white-label offering for payments. We manage 4 million consumers annually and process SEK 16 billion in volume from millions of transactions.
   

  

 At TF Avarda Group, you will have the opportunity to be part of an exciting journey as we build a state-of-the-art platform that transforms how e-commerce merchants handle payments. As a Senior .NET Developer, you will play a key role in designing and developing our backend systems, focusing on scalability and performance.
   

  

**Why** 
**should you join us?**
 We offer more than just a technical challenge – you will become part of a team building the future of payment solutions with modern, unified technology. With us, you can grow both technically and personally, as we shape stronger work processes and develop innovative solutions for future products. We are building a modern platform that supports current and future products, and you will help create a stronger company culture and more efficient ways of working.
   

  

 Our backend platform is based on the .NET stack and microservices architecture, mainly deployed in Azure.
   

  

 We have a distributed tech team with employees in Borås, Stockholm, Gdansk, Malaga, and a partner in the Czech Republic. Our payment and card services are used in 13 European markets, and travel may be required.
   

  

**The essential requirements:**
* At least 5 years of software development experience, particularly in C#, .NET Core, and Azure.
* Deep knowledge of system architecture, with experience designing and maintaining microservices.
* Coach junior developers and actively participate in technical and architectural decisions.


**It would be a plus if you also have:**
* Experience with integration, delivery, and deployment with Kubernetes, Docker, and Azure Pipelines.
* Experience with optimizing systems and applications for high performance and reliability.
* Experience with implementing logging and observability using OpenTelemetry.
* Experience in e-commerce, payment solutions, or finance.
* Fluency in Swedish writing and speaking.

title: Group Business Controller
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 175,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 







 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 







 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



  

**About the role**
 Group FP&A is responsible for the Group's management reporting, budgeting, forecasting, and long-range strategic planning. Additionally, we oversee several integration and strategic projects, ensuring alignment with the company's financial goals.
 







 We are now seeking a highly motivated and analytical Group Business Controller to join our Group FP&A team. This role offers a unique opportunity to work in a dynamic and strategic environment, supporting the Group Leadership Team and Board of Directors with critical financial insights and reporting.
 







**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Contribute to the development and preparation of management reports for the Group Leadership Team and Board of Directors.
* Play an active role in the Budget and Forecasting processes, ensuring accuracy and strategic alignment.
* Provide financial analysis and insights to support decision-making across the organization.
* Drive process improvements and efficiencies within the FP&A function.







 This role is based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden and reports to Head of Group FP&A.
 







**Requirements:** 




 In order to be successful in this role you have experience of working in an international complex organization. You have strong analytical skills with the ability to translate financial data into actionable insights. You are a people person and have excellent stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence and collaborate across functions.
 






* Experience of Group business controlling, or a similar role within a complex international organization
* Experience with financial reporting, budgeting, and forecasting processes.
* Strong proficiency in financial modeling and Excel; experience with financial planning systems is a plus. (Aaro, Tableau, Power BI)
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced and evolving environment.
* Fluency in English is required







 Big Plus:
 


* Exposure to FX is desirable







 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in English
 *.* 








 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation at this time.
 



 Applicants must:
 



 \* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship
   

 \* Have a valid Swedish work permit
 



  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Functional consultant Dynamics 365 CE Stockholm
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Som ett av Europas ledande konsultbolag inom digital transformation och med ett av Sveriges största team inom Dynamics 365, Power Platform och BI gör vi mer än att följa trender, vi skapar dem.
   

  

 Med över 50 000 experter globalt och som certifierad och managerad Microsoft Cloud Partner på högsta nivån, har vi kompetensen och specialiseringar att leverera hållbara, smarta lösningar som gör verklig skillnad. På Sopra Steria förenar vi teknik och syfte för att driva digital transformation med Azure OpenAI, Copilot, BI, Dynamics 365 och Power Platform. Tillsammans med våra kunder förenklar vi processer, stärker kundrelationer och skapar värde för både verksamhet och samhälle. Genom att tillämpa AI där det ger störst effekt hjälper vi organisationer att ta nästa steg i sin digitala resa.
   

  

 Rollen som funktionell konsult är bred och här jobbar du nära verksamheten och dina arbetsuppgifter kan till exempel inkludera anpassningar av systemet, framtagande av lösningsförslag, konfiguration, eller att på andra sätt hjälpa verksamheter framåt. Ofta arbetar vi också i en helhetsleverans tillsammans med kollegor från oss på Sopra Steria.
   

  

**Om Dig**
 Du är van att arbeta inom Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE och trivs med att skapa värde mot kund. Du har en förmåga att förstå företagsbehov och gillar att arbeta verksamhetsnära.
   

  

* Minst 4 års erfarenhet inom Dynamics 365 CE
* Kunna konfigurera i Dynamics 365 CRM (skapa tabeller, vyer, formulär etc.)
* Arbetat med tjänster inom Power Platform (low-code lösningar baserat på Power Apps och Power Automate)
* Erfarenhet och/eller intresse av att arbeta med Copilot Studio
* God kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Ansök nu – vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar och kallar till intervju löpande. På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Rekryteringsprocessen består av tre intervjuer, personlighet- och logiktest, referenstagning och bakgrundskontroll. Denna kombination av urvalsmetoder ger oss en bredare och mer rättvis bild av dig som kandidat, samtidigt som det säkerställer att både dina tekniska och personliga styrkor kommer till sin rätt. För dig som kandidat innebär det en möjlighet att visa din kompetens och potential från flera perspektiv.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Victoria Stjernström, v.stjernstroem@soprasteria.com
   

  

**Varför välja Sopra Steria**
* Fokus på kompetensutveckling och din personliga utveckling - vi kallar det för Power of sharing
* Stark företagskultur - utsedda till Sveriges bästa arbetsplats av Great Place to Work
* Europas ledande konsultbolag inom digitalisering med internationell närvaro. Läs mer om oss här


**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: 🇸🇪 Partneransvarig – Sverige
description:
🇸🇪 Partneransvarig – Sverige
 
  





**Plats:** 
  Hybridtjänst - Göteborg / Stockholm / Skåne
 



**Bolag:** 
 Energy Group AES AB
 



  






 Energy Group är Sveriges mest snabbväxande grossist inom energieffektivisering, mest specifikt på energilagring. Vi erbjuder både residential- och commercial-lösningar till andra grossister, installatörer och energibolag över hela Europa.
 




  





 Energy Group söker en 
 **partneransvarig** 
  som vill bygga långsiktiga relationer med våra återkommande och nya partners i Sverige, installatörsföretag inom energilagring och solceller. Rollen handlar om att stötta våra samarbetspartners i att växa, effektivisera sina verksamheter och öka sin försäljning med hjälp av våra lösningar.

 40-70.000kr/mån + provision + årsbonus + förmånsbil

* Skapa, underhålla och stärka relationer med svenska installatörsföretag
* Stötta partners i försäljning, utbildning och strategier
* Planera produktgenomgångar, kampanjer och säljstöd
* Identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter och utveckla samarbeten



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Har erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning eller partnerutveckling, gärna inom energi, el eller teknik
* Är kommunikativ, strukturerad och trivs med kundkontakt
* Har förmåga att se affärsmöjligheter och driva projekt från idé till resultat
* Har god förståelse för svenska batteribranschen i helhet



  





**Vi prioriterar erfarenhet** 




 Energy Group värdesätter 
 **kompetens, branscherfarenhet och relationsbyggande förmåga.** 
 Fast lön och ersättningsnivå sätts individuellt efter erfarenhet. Fast lön och ersättningsmodell baseras på kompetens och erfarenhet, och vi är beredda att erbjuda 
 **mycket konkurrenskraftiga villkor** 
  till rätt person.

title: Measurement Solutions Field Application Engineer
description:
**Intro Text**
--------------

**Are you an experienced engineer with deep technical understanding of communication and data collection in the automotive industry? Do you want to work with the latest technology in measurement systems while being part of a global company with a strong local culture? Then you are welcome to apply for this position.**

  

As a **Measurement Solutions Engineer** at **Vector**, you will work closely with our customers in the Nordics and our international colleagues using the latest technology. You will be a technical expert in the measurement and analysis of embedded systems.


Our platform for advanced measurement and analysis is called **CANape**, which can also run on specially developed hardware. **VX1000** is our interface for embedded systems. See https://www.vector.com/canape

  

You will have the opportunity to influence the future of mobility in an industry currently undergoing a technological revolution. We are looking for someone who wants to help drive that development forward. Real-time measurement and analysis on Linux-based systems is one example. Travel is primarily within Sweden, but occasionally within the Nordics and to our headquarters in Germany.

 **Vector** is a global technology company with over 4,500 employees at more than 30 locations worldwide. We develop tools, software, and services to simplify the development of embedded systems. In Sweden, we have offices in Gothenburg (Lindholmen Science Park) and Linköping, where we combine the closeness of a small company with the resources of a large one.

**Your Tasks**
--------------

* Consulting on measurement solutions and data mining / advanced analysis for embedded systems in automotive (light and heavy vehicles)
* Assisting our customers as an expert with advanced troubleshooting, analysis, and data mining
* Collaborating with international teams and participating in global projects at Vector
* Contributing to technical presentations, seminars, and knowledge sharing
**Your Profile**
----------------

* Several years of industry experience, high service level, and self-drive with a “go the extra mile” attitude
* Programming experience, as we often assist our customers with customized scripts for our products
* Solid understanding of communication buses in automotive such as CAN, Ethernet, and XCP, among others
* Strong understanding of embedded systems and real-time systems from both a hardware and software perspective
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
**Techstack**
-------------

*C & C++*
company_description: Vector ist der kompetente Partner für die Entwicklung von Elektronik im Automobil – und das seit über 35 Jahren, mit mehr als 4.500 Mitarbeitenden an über 30 Standorten weltweit.

title: Automotive Test Solutions Engineer
description:
**Intro Text**
--------------

**Are you an experienced engineer with deep technical understanding of test environments in the automotive industry? Do you want to work with the latest technology in safety-critical systems while being part of a global company with a strong local culture? Then you are welcome to apply for this position.**

  

As a **Test Solutions Engineer** at **Vector**, you will work closely with our customers and international colleagues using the latest technology. You will be a technical expert in test environments and tools such as **CANoe**, **VT System**, and **virtualization**.


You will have the opportunity to influence the future of mobility in an industry currently undergoing a technological revolution. We are looking for someone who wants to help drive that development forward — *“From Software Factory to HIL Farms.”*

 **Vector** is a global technology company with over 4,500 employees at more than 30 locations worldwide. We develop tools, software, and services to simplify the development of embedded systems. In Sweden, we have offices in Gothenburg (Lindholmen Science Park) and Linköping, where we combine the closeness of a small company with the resources of a large one.

**Your Tasks**
--------------

* Consulting on the design and implementation of test solutions for embedded systems in automotive and/or MedTech
* Assisting our customers as an expert with advanced troubleshooting and analysis
* Collaborating with international teams and participating in global projects
* Contributing to technical presentations, seminars, and knowledge sharing
**Your Profile**
----------------

* Several years of experience in testing and verification, with a high level of service
* Programming experience in C/C++
* Deep knowledge of HIL as well as SIL
* Solid understanding of embedded systems and real-time systems
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written
**Techstack**
-------------

*C & C++*
company_description: Vector ist der kompetente Partner für die Entwicklung von Elektronik im Automobil – und das seit über 35 Jahren, mit mehr als 4.500 Mitarbeitenden an über 30 Standorten weltweit.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
November 14, 2025
Full Time
Sweden
Posted 16 hours ago
We are hiring **Senior Analytics Engineer**for the position based in **Lund, Sweden (Onsite).**


**Educational Qualification:** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, or a related field.


**Job Summary:**



We are seeking a **Senior Analytics Engineer** with strong expertise in developing intelligent scene representations, semantic data models, and real-time analytical solutions. This role will involve designing and implementing advanced systems for multi-source data fusion and contextual understanding, contributing directly to next-generation perception and decision-making platforms.



**Required Experience/Competences:**


* **7–8 years** of hands-on experience in **Software development** using **Python and C++.**
* Strong foundation in **architectural design**, maintainable coding practices, and end-to-end development cycles.
* Proven experience in **semantic modeling**, **scene understanding**, and **multi-source data fusion.**
* Solid understanding of **computer vision, video analysis**, and **real-time analytics.**
* Proficiency in **algorithm design**, **data handling,** and **system optimization.**
* Experience deploying solutions in **operational** or **production-grade environments.**
* Prior experience **leading** or **mentoring** technical teams.
* Familiarity with **multimodal data integration beyond video**.
* Background in developing **analytics platforms for safety or operational efficiency**.
* Working knowledge of the Swedish **language** is a plus.


**Soft Skills:**


* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset with a focus on quality and innovation.
* Collaborative and proactive attitude with the ability to work independently in dynamic environments.
* Passion for continuous learning, system optimization, and cutting-edge technology.
